title: APT / STUDENT COMMUNIST
description: The Student Communist and his underground reading group (PART OF THE COMMUNIST DREAM QUEST)

dialogueTree.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Would you mind? We've got *group b..."
dialogueTree.text: "Would you mind? We've got *group business* to take care of."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""That means go home, gendarme.""
links.text: "That means go home, gendarme."

dialogueTree.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You know," the young man looks up..."
dialogueTree.text: "You know," the young man looks up at you as you enter, "if you wanted to borrow my jacket, you could've just *asked*..."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It looks better on you, anyway. He..."
links.text: It looks better on you, anyway. He never had the shoulders for it.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But no matter. What's on your mind?""
links.text: "But no matter. What's on your mind?"

links.title: You: ""What *exactly* are you two doing h..."
links.text: "What *exactly* are you two doing here?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""In the most general sense, I would..."
links.text: "In the most general sense, I would say we're cultivating revolutionary consciousness."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Yes, that's probably the best way..."
links.text: "Yes, that's probably the best way to describe it."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But more specifically, we're runni..."
links.text: "But more specifically, we're running a reading group, the most rigorous and theoretically advanced materialist reading group in Martinaise."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Comrade Steban is a great discussi..."
links.text: "Comrade Steban is a great discussion leader. One of the best at the university."

links.title: Logic: "It's obvious they take this 'group'..."
links.text: It's obvious they take this 'group' of theirs extremely seriously. Whatever you do, *don't* compare it to a common book club.

links.title: Half Light: "*YAWWWWN!* Can you imagine anything..."
links.text: *YAWWWWN!* Can you imagine anything duller than a bunch of binoclards yanking each others' knobs?

links.title: You: ""Is this where I can square off in..."
links.text: "Is this where I can square off in *theory combat*?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We have been known to get into som..."
links.text: "We have been known to get into some *spirited* debates. But it's always in service of our larger intellectual and ideological project."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Precisely. We're not interested in..."
links.text: "Precisely. We're not interested in senseless parroting. We like to read *critically*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Within the contours of Mazovian hi..."
links.text: "Within the contours of Mazovian historical materialism, of course."

links.title: You: ""I didn't realise they taught radic..."
links.text: "I didn't realise they taught radical Mazovian theory in the universities."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Ha! As though you can call that pa..."
links.text: "Ha! As though you can call that pablum *teaching*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""One thing you learn quickly at uni..."
links.text: "One thing you learn quickly at university is that you're not going to find a real education in any lecture hall or discussion seminar."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""We're post-attendance, basically.""
links.text: "We're post-attendance, basically."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Exactly. The only worthwhile part..."
links.text: "Exactly. The only worthwhile part of the so-called École normale de Revachol is the library. That's where we've made our greatest critical strides."

links.title: You: "“Kim, can we arrest these kids for..."
links.text: “Kim, can we arrest these kids for truancy?”

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They’re not primary school delinqu..."
links.text: "They’re not primary school delinquents, they’re university students. Attendance isn't compulsory. Besides, we’re not the skip squad."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Counter-Truancy Task Force (or..."
links.text: The Counter-Truancy Task Force (or 'skip squad') is the division of the RCM that drives around in wagons looking for delinquent minors. It's generally considered a punitive assignment for under-performing officers.

links.title: You: ""Okay, so what does your reading gr..."
links.text: "Okay, so what does your reading group actually *read*?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We study all the foundational text..."
links.text: "We study all the foundational texts of Mazovian theory, of course. Just last week we finished the second volume of Puncher and Wattmann's 'Innocence of Capital'..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Truly extraordinary.""
links.text: "Truly extraordinary."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""And before that we spent six weeks..."
links.text: "And before that we spent six weeks on 'State and Plasm'..."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "For some reason the word *plasm* ca..."
links.text: For some reason the word *plasm* catches in your ear like a piece of old wax.

links.title: Volition: "Uh oh, you can feel your attention..."
links.text: Uh oh, you can feel your attention span rapidly deteriorating...

links.title: You: "Let your mind wander."
links.text: Let your mind wander.

links.title: Volition: "Your attention detaches. The voices..."
links.text: Your attention detaches. The voices of the young men fade away. It's a cool evening, you notice.

links.title: You: "Listen for night sounds."
links.text: Listen for night sounds.

links.title: Volition: "Out beyond the dull chatter, you ca..."
links.text: Out beyond the dull chatter, you catch the sound of a distant seabird, and of course the sound of the large stretches of canvas that cover the missing sections of wall...

links.title: Conceptualization: "The way they billow in the night br..."
links.text: The way they billow in the night breeze reminds you of something...

links.title: You: "A patch of ocean turned on its side..."
links.text: A patch of ocean turned on its side...

links.title: Conceptualization: "That must be it. You imagine yourse..."
links.text: That must be it. You imagine yourself in a small dinghy buoyed along gentle swells...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "In another life, you might've made..."
links.text: In another life, you might've made a fine seafaring man. Who knows, you may become one yet.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Gradually, the pleasant sensation r..."
links.text: Gradually, the pleasant sensation recedes. You turn your attention to the two young men, who appear just about finished.

links.title: You: "A woman's skirt swelling in the bre..."
links.text: A woman's skirt swelling in the breeze...

links.title: Conceptualization: "The thought is almost too much to b..."
links.text: The thought is almost too much to bear. What you wouldn't give to glimpse the bare legs behind it...

links.title: Pain Threshold: "The more it hurts, the more you hav..."
links.text: The more it hurts, the more you have to have it.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Slowly, too slowly, the pain fades..."
links.text: Slowly, too slowly, the pain fades from your side. You turn your attention to the two young men, who appear just about finished.

links.title: You: "A wild beast tangled in a sheet..."
links.text: A wild beast tangled in a sheet...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes, an image to get the blood pump..."
links.text: Yes, an image to get the blood pumping. An unpredictable power, fighting to free itself...

links.title: Half Light: "The beast is *you*, a mass of teeth..."
links.text: The beast is *you*, a mass of teeth and claws and violent urges.

links.title: Conceptualization: "You let the invigorating sensation..."
links.text: You let the invigorating sensation course through you, then turn your attention to the two young men, who appear just about finished.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It reminds you of something, but yo..."
links.text: It reminds you of something, but you can't think of what. Oh well, let's see if the students are still going...

links.title: Echo Maker: ""And before that, there was Abelard..."
links.text: "And before that, there was Abelard's 'Un Pays Infernal'..."

links.title: You: "Look around the room."
links.text: Look around the room.

links.title: Volition: "Your eye drifts over the detritus a..."
links.text: Your eye drifts over the detritus and mismatched furniture. It naturally gravitates toward the pieces of canvas that cover a missing stretch of wall...

links.title: You: "Force yourself to keep listening."
links.text: Force yourself to keep listening.

links.title: Volition: "This is fine. You can handle a list..."
links.text: This is fine. You can handle a list. In fact, you find the tedium strangely soothing.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We've also read Wertmüller's 'The..."
links.text: "We've also read Wertmüller's 'The Mega-Structure of History,' and before that, 'Reál and Reality'..."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Communist theorists love puns, in c..."
links.text: Communist theorists love puns, in case that wasn't obvious.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Abelard's 'Un Pays Infernal'...""
links.text: "Abelard's 'Un Pays Infernal'..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""The original Fizdale translation,..."
links.text: "The original Fizdale translation, not that watered-down revisionist garbage."

links.title: Drama: "These two deserve the Order of Hono..."
links.text: These two deserve the Order of Honour for Bullshitting. There's no way they've actually *read* all this stuff.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Obviously." He snorts."
links.text: "Obviously." He snorts.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But, of course, our *special empha..."
links.text: "But, of course, our *special emphasis* is on the theories of Ignus Nilsen and his followers, especially the infra-materialists."

links.title: You: ""I think I get the idea. Let me ask..."
links.text: "I think I get the idea. Let me ask about something else."

links.title: You: ""Sounds like a place for intense in..."
links.text: "Sounds like a place for intense intellectual engagement. Exactly my kind of jam."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's our whole *thing*. The worl..."
links.text: "That's our whole *thing*. The world is so shallow, all noise and repetition. We're interested in genuinely radical critique."

links.title: You: ""Sounds just like a regular book cl..."
links.text: "Sounds just like a regular book club."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's really nothing like that." Th..."
links.text: "It's really nothing like that." The young man scoffs. "A book club is a place for talking about the plot points of bourgeois social novels and sipping effervescent cocktails."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Extremely different from discussing..."
links.text: Extremely different from discussing the aesthetic merits of avant-garde literature while quaffing a fine Mirovan red, eh, Art Cop?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That doesn't sound so bad," the li..."
links.text: "That doesn't sound so bad," the lieutenant says. "In any case, it's healthier than certain *other* after-hours pursuits I've seen officers engage in." He gives you a pointed look.

links.title: You: ""Sounds like a yank-fest for binos.""
links.text: "Sounds like a yank-fest for binos."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's nothing like that. A yank-fes..."
links.text: "It's nothing like that. A yank-fest is a decadent bourgeois phenomenon, a pastime for over-educated office workers who lack proper revolutionary outlets for their social dissatisfactions and repressed sexuality."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Repressed sexualities are somethin..."
links.text: "Repressed sexualities are something of an *idée fixe* of his."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""One of capitalism's more banal pat..."
links.text: "One of capitalism's more banal pathologies. But let's move on."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But now we're getting hung up on t..."
links.text: "But now we're getting hung up on the pathologies of capitalism. Let's move on."

links.title: You: ""Did this reading group have anythi..."
links.text: "Did this reading group have anything to do with the lynching?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Lynching? No. We're not an *operat..."
links.text: "Lynching? No. We're not an *operational* cell."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""We think of ourselves as more of a..."
links.text: "We think of ourselves as more of an intellectual vanguard."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but what's your group's stan..."
links.text: "Okay, but what's your group's stance on the lynching?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To be clear: Communism is not an o..."
links.text: "To be clear: Communism is not an official suspect in this investigation. Because it's not a *person*, you see."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Seems unlikely, from a strictly in..."
links.text: "Seems unlikely, from a strictly infra-materialist perspective..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Comrade Ulixes is right. The amoun..."
links.text: "Comrade Ulixes is right. The amount of plasm required to strike down an ideological enemy outright is enormous. We're talking second-level effects, at a minimum."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Or even *third*.""
links.text: "Or even *third*."

links.title: Conceptualization: "What are these levels they're talki..."
links.text: What are these levels they're talking about? This doesn't sound like any communism you've encountered before...

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You're saying you think the mercen..."
links.text: "You're saying you think the mercenary was killed *by* communism itself?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Our stance? What, does he want to..."
links.text: "Our stance? What, does he want to know if the SRV has established a party line on lynchings in Martinaise?" The two young men look at one another.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Though historically speaking, the..."
links.text: "Though historically speaking, the SRV *has supported* direct action against right-wing paramilitary squads, especially when they're doing the Indotribes' dirty work."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Good point. So as a provisional ma..."
links.text: "Good point. So as a provisional matter, I can say we support it."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It's not that the boundary between..."
links.text: It's not that the boundary between sarcasm and sincerity is porous with these two, it's that they actually seem to *overlap*, as though one is meant to conceal the other.

links.title: Empathy: "It's always that way. Beneath the c..."
links.text: It's always that way. Beneath the crust of irony there's a molten sincerity that threatens to erupt forth... You may witness it yet.

links.title: Rhetoric: "One thing *is* perfectly clear: The..."
links.text: One thing *is* perfectly clear: These young students have a much deeper understanding of communism than you do...

links.title: Rhetoric: "You could learn a thing or two from..."
links.text: You could learn a thing or two from them, if you can convince them you're one of them.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Are they being sarcastic? You feel..."
links.text: Are they being sarcastic? You feel like you're caught in some elaborate joke labyrinth, but it's impossible to see your way through.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The SRV refers to the People's Repu..."
links.text: The SRV refers to the People's Republic of Samara. Established as a socialist utopia by survivors of the Revolution, it has since degenerated into a bureaucratic workers' state under the decades-long rule of President Sapormat 'Sport' Knezhinisky.

links.title: You: ""Is your reading group affiliated w..."
links.text: "Is your reading group affiliated with the Union somehow?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""No, we're an independent organisat..."
links.text: "No, we're an independent organisation," he says proudly. "We acknowledge and respect the Union's efforts, but our interests are more theoretical than Mr. Claire's."

links.title: Drama: "He speaks the truth."
links.text: He speaks the truth.

links.title: You: ""So what's your stance on crime in..."
links.text: "So what's your stance on crime in general?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's easy: Crime is simply the i..."
links.text: "That's easy: Crime is simply the inevitable expression of the injustice and incoherence embedded within capitalism itself."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Delivered with the smug assurance o..."
links.text: Delivered with the smug assurance of a schoolboy reciting a maxim he's committed to memory.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's a symptom, in other words. No..."
links.text: "It's a symptom, in other words. Not a cause." He waves his hand as though this is all there is to say on the subject of crime.

links.title: Echo Maker: "His companion can barely suppress a..."
links.text: His companion can barely suppress a yawn.

links.title: You: ""*Are* there any operational commun..."
links.text: "*Are* there any operational communists in Martinaise?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""No, unfortunately. The communards..."
links.text: "No, unfortunately. The communards were hunted down and killed nearly to a man. All that's left of them are bones and old rifles."

links.title: You: ""Like this one." (Show him the Bell..."
links.text: "Like this one." (Show him the Belle-Magrave rifle.)

links.title: Echo Maker: "His companion's eyes widen as you h..."
links.text: His companion's eyes widen as you hold up the ancient weapon.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "He's practically itching to stick t..."
links.text: He's practically itching to stick that thing in someone's face and pull the trigger.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Yes, like that one. I wonder how m..."
links.text: "Yes, like that one. I wonder how many of these are still lying around in cellars or sealed up behind the masonry." He knits his brows together, and then looks up.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Can I hold it?""
links.text: "Can I hold it?"

links.title: You: ""Here." (Give him the rifle.)"
links.text: "Here." (Give him the rifle.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's heavier than I was expecting...."
links.text: "It's heavier than I was expecting." The rifle rests in his open palms. Its position reminds you of something...

links.title: Shivers: "The attitude of a priest bearing on..."
links.text: The attitude of a priest bearing one of the holy relics of his faith. Though it is long out-of-service, its power is evident to him.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "When he's finished, he returns the..."
links.text: When he's finished, he returns the rifle to you with a nod of appreciation.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "... though what, exactly, you can't..."
links.text: ... though what, exactly, you can't say. He turns the rifle over again, admiring the glint of light off the oily barrel.

links.title: You: ""I'd prefer you didn't." (Put it aw..."
links.text: "I'd prefer you didn't." (Put it away.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Of course. What would I even do wi..."
links.text: "Of course. What would I even do with it?" He gives you a half-smile.

links.title: Empathy: "He doesn't mean to show it, but the..."
links.text: He doesn't mean to show it, but the disappointment is plainly written across his face.

links.title: You: ""This little guy is still going." (..."
links.text: "This little guy is still going." (Show him the figurine.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Not exactly the second incarnation..."
links.text: "Not exactly the second incarnation of Kras Mazov, is he?" The young man considers the figurine with a slight grimace.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""What's it for?""
links.text: "What's it for?"

links.title: You: ""I'm holding onto it for someone.""
links.text: "I'm holding onto it for someone."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Ah, I see. That's certainly kind o..."
links.text: "Ah, I see. That's certainly kind of you." He gives you a curious half-smile.

links.title: You: ""It kills fascists.""
links.text: "It kills fascists."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Right. Sure he does." He gives you..."
links.text: "Right. Sure he does." He gives you a sly half-smile.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean? It's just a nice..."
links.text: "What do you mean? It's just a nice figurine."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Right, of course it is." He gives..."
links.text: "Right, of course it is." He gives you a sad half-smile.

links.title: You: ""Right. They all got shot in the he..."
links.text: "Right. They all got shot in the head, just like the anarchists."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""The Insulindian Deluge wiped out a..."
links.text: "The Insulindian Deluge wiped out an entire generation of communists. Afterward, they were all bulldozed into mass graves." The young man looks slightly queasy at the thought.

links.title: Echo Maker: "His friend, though, seems oddly unm..."
links.text: His friend, though, seems oddly unmoved.

links.title: Half Light: "On the contrary, he appears to be *..."
links.text: On the contrary, he appears to be *savouring* the thought of so many people shot in the head, regardless of their beliefs.

links.title: Empathy: "Mark it, there's something sinister..."
links.text: Mark it, there's something sinister in that one.

links.title: You: ""Well, that's too bad.""
links.text: "Well, that's too bad."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's a world-historical nightmare,..."
links.text: "It's a world-historical nightmare," the young man says gravely. "One from which we've yet to awaken."

links.title: Inland Empire: "When will *you* wake up? And what w..."
links.text: When will *you* wake up? And what will you see when you do?

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "A moment of silence. They're waitin..."
links.text: A moment of silence. They're waiting for you to speak.

links.title: You: ""Where is the rest of the reading g..."
links.text: "Where is the rest of the reading group?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""What do you mean? This *is* the re..."
links.text: "What do you mean? This *is* the reading group..."

links.title: You: ""So there's just two of you?""
links.text: "So there's just two of you?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We're in something of a rebuilding..."
links.text: "We're in something of a rebuilding phase."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Some of our former comrades didn't..."
links.text: "Some of our former comrades didn't have the *ideological fortitude* our work demands."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but what happened to them?""
links.text: "Okay, but what happened to them?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Intellectual attrition is maybe th..."
links.text: "Intellectual attrition is maybe the best way to describe it. Felix said he couldn't keep up with the reading on top of his classwork. And Zuzanna wanted to read texts *other than* Mazovian theory. Like novels, if you can believe it..."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Imagine, the audacity of wanting to..."
links.text: Imagine, the audacity of wanting to read a novel in a reading group!

links.title: You: ""Novels, unbelievable." (Shake your..."
links.text: "Novels, unbelievable." (Shake your head.)

links.title: Echo Maker: ""See? Even a gendarme gets it.""
links.text: "See? Even a gendarme gets it."

links.title: You: ""I like a good novel every now and..."
links.text: "I like a good novel every now and then."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, sure. But you can always join..."
links.text: "Oh, sure. But you can always join a *book club* if that's what you're into."

links.title: You: ""Maybe you just haven't found the r..."
links.text: "Maybe you just haven't found the right group yet?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We've tried recruiting new members..."
links.text: "We've tried recruiting new members, but unfortunately the *current intellectual climate* is pretty hostile to infra-materialist thought. These days, if you're on the left, the ascendent schools are the Gottwaldians and the Econoclards."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Don't forget about Maurice and the..."
links.text: "Don't forget about Maurice and the turnips."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "He sighs. "Right, then there was th..."
links.text: He sighs. "Right, then there was the whole 'turnip' debacle."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Whatever this turnip business is ab..."
links.text: Whatever this turnip business is about, one thing *is* perfectly clear: These young students have a much deeper understanding of communism than you do...

links.title: Rhetoric: "You could learn a thing or two from..."
links.text: You could learn a thing or two from them, if you can convince them you're one of them.

links.title: You: ""What's so bad about the Gottwaldia..."
links.text: "What's so bad about the Gottwaldians?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""They're the most depressing school..."
links.text: "They're the most depressing school of communism. They love writing long books with a patina of Mazovian theory to cover up their cheap psychologising."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""A gang of cheap psychologists and..."
links.text: "A gang of cheap psychologists and intellectual midgets." His companion sneers. "Typical Gottwalders, in other words."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's okay for Uli to say that beca..."
links.text: "It's okay for Uli to say that because his dad is from Gottwald."

links.title: You: ""What's so depressing about their t..."
links.text: "What's so depressing about their theories?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""The Gottwald School believe that i..."
links.text: "The Gottwald School believe that intellectuals as a class are incapable of sparking revolutionary change, so all they can do is *critique* capitalism from inside itself."

links.title: Logic: "In other words, they have lost fait..."
links.text: In other words, they have lost faith in their own relevance.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's why they spend all their ti..."
links.text: "That's why they spend all their time smoking cigarettes and writing long works of criticism that make you want to commit suicide."

links.title: You: ""That sounds miserable.""
links.text: "That sounds miserable."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It *is* miserable. That's probably..."
links.text: "It *is* miserable. That's probably why they're always committing suicide."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You see, the Gottwald School *look..."
links.text: "You see, the Gottwald School *look* like communists, they *talk* like communists, but scratch the patina and you'll see beneath that they're just depressed liberals who've read too many books."

links.title: You: ""Sounds rewarding, actually.""
links.text: "Sounds rewarding, actually."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""If it were, they wouldn't keep com..."
links.text: "If it were, they wouldn't keep committing suicide."

links.title: You: ""What's so bad about psychologising?""
links.text: "What's so bad about psychologising?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Do you think all the problems in t..."
links.text: "Do you think all the problems in the world can be reduced to repressed sexual urges?"

links.title: Logic: "No, of course not. That's reductive..."
links.text: No, of course not. That's reductive in the extreme.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "One-thousand percent, yes."
links.text: One-thousand percent, yes.

links.title: You: ""Probably not.""
links.text: "Probably not."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, there you have it. You're no..."
links.text: "Well, there you have it. You're not a Gottwaldian, then."

links.title: You: ""Speaking from experience, definite..."
links.text: "Speaking from experience, definitely."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I can tell you're a man who has hi..."
links.text: "I can tell you're a man who has his urges, but I can also tell you're no Gottwaldian." He smirks.

links.title: You: ""Who are the Econoclards?""
links.text: "Who are the Econoclards?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""For starters, they love talking ab..."
links.text: "For starters, they love talking about *beans*."

links.title: You: ""*Beans*?""
links.text: "*Beans*?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's right. Econoclards are *obs..."
links.text: "That's right. Econoclards are *obsessed* with beans. They love thinking about beans, they love counting beans, but most of all, they love building models to predict how many beans there'll be *in the future*."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Nota bene: 'Econoclard' is an extra..."
links.text: Nota bene: 'Econoclard' is an extra-pejorative form of the already pejorative name 'Mazovian Economists', a moderate school of Mazovianism, which advocates a gradual transition to communism through carefully managed economic modernisation rather than violent social revolution.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""They're by far the most bean-centr..."
links.text: "They're by far the most bean-centric school of communism."

links.title: Empathy: "Ah yes, the much maligned bean coun..."
links.text: Ah yes, the much maligned bean counters, ensconced in their think-tanks and highrises, believing they can save the world through a series of incremental, assiduously technocratic reforms...

links.title: You: ""I don't get it. Are the beans a *m..."
links.text: "I don't get it. Are the beans a *metaphor*?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""If only! They've got all the beans..."
links.text: "If only! They've got all the beans accounted for in their asset sheets, their quarterly budgets, their future projections. But for some reason there are never enough beans to go around, so we've just got to cut our bean rations in half..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... and next thing you know there..."
links.text: "... and next thing you know there are *budget cuts*, so now we've got to cut the bean rations in half *again*..."

links.title: You: ""But isn't it good to know how many..."
links.text: "But isn't it good to know how many beans there are?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""See? You're already falling for th..."
links.text: "See? You're already falling for that scarcity logic. You start off *assuming* there aren't enough beans to go around, so naturally you want to cut the bean rations in half..."

links.title: You: ""What's wrong with making progress..."
links.text: "What's wrong with making progress through moderate economic reforms?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, please. There's nothing 'moder..."
links.text: "Oh, please. There's nothing 'moderate' about their love for counting beans. If I were a Gottwaldian, I would probably diagnose them with *Bohnenfixierung*..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You see, Econoclards claim to be c..."
links.text: "You see, Econoclards claim to be communists, but in reality they're just liberals with hard-ons for spreadsheets."

links.title: You: ""What's wrong with beans? I like be..."
links.text: "What's wrong with beans? I like beans."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, sure. But Econoclards are *obs..."
links.text: "Oh, sure. But Econoclards are *obsessed* with beans. They love thinking about beans, they love counting beans, but most of all, they love building models to predict how many beans there'll be *in the future*."

links.title: You: ""No beans for me. Can't stand the s..."
links.text: "No beans for me. Can't stand the stuff."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You're no Econoclard, then. They'r..."
links.text: "You're no Econoclard, then. They're *obsessed* with beans. They love thinking about beans, they love counting beans, but most of all, they love building models to predict how many beans there'll be *in the future*."

links.title: You: ""And what about the liberals? Are t..."
links.text: "And what about the liberals? Are they liberals, too?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Of course not. The only people who..."
links.text: "Of course not. The only people who actually call themselves liberals are mouth-foaming reactionaries."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Basically indistinguishable from f..."
links.text: "Basically indistinguishable from fascists. You'd need an x-ray machine to tell the difference."

links.title: You: ""What about Cindy, is she part of t..."
links.text: "What about Cindy, is she part of the group?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Cindy is... how to describe her *r..."
links.text: "Cindy is... how to describe her *role*..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""... something of an ideological au..."
links.text: "... something of an ideological auxiliary, perhaps."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Yes, that's exactly how I would pu..."
links.text: "Yes, that's exactly how I would put it. And naturally we support her radical counter-liberal aesthetics."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""But she refuses to submit an essay..."
links.text: "But she refuses to submit an essay, so we can't call her a member of the group *per se*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That doesn't stop her from using t..."
links.text: "That doesn't stop her from using the room for studio space, of course."

links.title: You: ""Did you say something about *turni..."
links.text: "Did you say something about *turnips*?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "Another sigh. “It's an unfortunate..."
links.text: Another sigh. “It's an unfortunate story. You see, our ex-comrade Maurice is something of an economist...”

links.title: Echo Maker: "“He’s studying macro- *and* micro-e..."
links.text: “He’s studying macro- *and* micro-economics.”

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wow, a *real* intellectual, it sou..."
links.text: "Wow, a *real* intellectual, it sounds like." The lieutenant arches his eyebrows.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "“Right, so a few weeks ago we were..."
links.text: “Right, so a few weeks ago we were discussing the extra-physical capabilities of the revolutionary state, and Maurice said... what were his exact words, Ulixes?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It was unbelievable. He said, 'Tur..."
links.text: "It was unbelievable. He said, 'Turnips don't care if they're grown by communists, moralists, or welkin. They grow just the same'."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Just a minute. Steban... Ulixes......"
links.text: Just a minute. Steban... Ulixes... *why* do those names ring the faintest of bells?

links.title: Logic: "Probably because they're the real n..."
links.text: Probably because they're the real names of 'Nasteb' and 'Exilus', the authors of that so-called essay about TipTop Tournée you read in *La Fumée*.

links.title: Conceptualization: "You should get to the bottom of thi..."
links.text: You should get to the bottom of this, when you have the chance.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Basically, he was rejecting the wh..."
links.text: "Basically, he was rejecting the whole foundation of infra-materialist theory."

links.title: You: ""Man, what an ignoramus." (Shake yo..."
links.text: "Man, what an ignoramus." (Shake your head.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We're extremely disappointed. Maur..."
links.text: "We're extremely disappointed. Maurice used to be a good friend of ours."

links.title: You: ""To be fair, the theory *is* pretty..."
links.text: "To be fair, the theory *is* pretty out there."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I'll grant you it can be overwhelm..."
links.text: "I'll grant you it can be overwhelming at first, but once you understand the basics, it's all quite intuitive..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Providing you haven't been hanging..."
links.text: "Providing you haven't been hanging out with non-communists, like Maurice."

links.title: Logic: "What is this *infra-materialist* bu..."
links.text: What is this *infra-materialist* business they keep blathering about? You've never heard of anything like it.

links.title: You: ""Remind me what infra-materialist t..."
links.text: "Remind me what infra-materialist theory says about turnips again?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Simply that *under suitably revolu..."
links.text: "Simply that *under suitably revolutionary conditions* crop yields naturally increase relative to non-revolutionary crops. Which Maurice somehow has the gall to deny."

links.title: You: "Just go along with it."
links.text: Just go along with it.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Zuzanna said that he has been hang..."
links.text: "Zuzanna said that he has been hanging out with some non-communists lately."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""For us the question boiled down to..."
links.text: "For us the question boiled down to: 'If you don't even accept the basic ideas of Nilsen and infra-materialist theory, why are you in the reading group?'"

links.title: You: ""Right, and this Nilsen is...?""
links.text: "Right, and this Nilsen is...?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Nilsen. Ignus Nilsen.""
links.text: "Nilsen. Ignus Nilsen."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "One of Kras Mazov's closest associa..."
links.text: One of Kras Mazov's closest associates, Ignus Nilsen was a leading political and military figure in the Antecentennial Revolution.

links.title: Half Light: "Why do you always leave out the goo..."
links.text: Why do you always leave out the good parts? Tell him how he got his *true name*, right now!

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Oh, right. During the disastrous re..."
links.text: Oh, right. During the disastrous retreat from Graad to Samara, Nilsen personally ordered up to 12,000 prisoners of war impaled on sharpened spruce trees in the Samaran backcountry. Thereafter his opponents began referring to him as the 'Apocalyptic Shrike'.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Today, Nilsen's reputation has wane..."
links.text: Today, Nilsen's reputation has waned in most parts of the developed world, with the exception of the People's Republic of Samara (SRV), where he is recognized as a founding father. His political philosophy is a variant of Mazovianism called Nilsenist-Mazovianism.

links.title: You: ""Comrade Nilsen, father of the SRV...."
links.text: "Comrade Nilsen, father of the SRV." (Raise your fist.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man raises his fist in re..."
links.text: The young man raises his fist in reply and gives you a curt nod.

links.title: You: ""Ignus Nilsen? He's not so popular..."
links.text: "Ignus Nilsen? He's not so popular these days, is he?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Only because certain moralists and..."
links.text: "Only because certain moralists and their ideological lap dogs pretend to object to his more *maximalist* tactics... as though they've never committed any so-called 'war crimes'."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man grimaces. It seems he..."
links.text: The young man grimaces. It seems he's less than 100% comfortable with war crimes.

links.title: You: ""Isn't he the guy who had all those..."
links.text: "Isn't he the guy who had all those prisoners impaled on spruce trees?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""This gendarme talks just like a mo..."
links.text: "This gendarme talks just like a moralist. They *love* getting on their high horses about so-called 'war crimes'."

links.title: You: ""Wait, who are these *infra-materia..."
links.text: "Wait, who are these *infra-materialists*?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You're not familiar with them? It'..."
links.text: "You're not familiar with them? It's... pretty advanced stuff. You may not be ready for it yet, gendarme." The two young men exchange skeptical side-glances.

links.title: You: ""Okay, but then who's this 'Ignus N..."
links.text: "Okay, but then who's this 'Ignus Nilsen' guy?"

links.title: You: ""I know who Kras Mazov is, but who..."
links.text: "I know who Kras Mazov is, but who is this 'Ignus Nilsen' guy?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Only Kras Mazov's most trusted lie..."
links.text: "Only Kras Mazov's most trusted lieutenant, the Evangelist of the Revolution, and the founding father of the People's Republic of Samara."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's hard to overstate how unimpres..."
links.text: It's hard to overstate how unimpressed he is that you've never heard of this world-historical individual.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""He *also* happens to be the greate..."
links.text: "He *also* happens to be the greatest communist theorist after Mazov himself. It was Nilsen who first postulated the existence of ideological plasm, which forms the basis of infra-materialist theory."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Those words again! You've got to fi..."
links.text: Those words again! You've got to find out what this infra-materialist stuff is all about.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Whatever it is, one thing's perfect..."
links.text: Whatever it is, one thing's perfectly clear: These young students have a much deeper understanding of communism than you do...

links.title: Rhetoric: "You could learn a thing or two from..."
links.text: You could learn a thing or two from them, if you can convince them you're *one* of them.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man sighs. His companion..."
links.text: The young man sighs. His companion looks about furtively.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "'Plasm', huh? Sounds like a hell of..."
links.text: 'Plasm', huh? Sounds like a hell of a drug. You might wanna ask about it.

links.title: You: ""I totally understand.""
links.text: "I totally understand."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Of course you do. It's pretty basi..."
links.text: "Of course you do. It's pretty basic stuff!"

links.title: You: ""I don't understand at all.""
links.text: "I don't understand at all."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Exactly. What educated person coul..."
links.text: "Exactly. What educated person could believe that turnips grow at the same rate under capitalism *and* communism?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It's a sad reflection on our educa..."
links.text: "It's a sad reflection on our educational institutions."

links.title: You: ""So you expelled Maurice from the r..."
links.text: "So you expelled Maurice from the reading group over an argument about turnips?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, it wasn't so much that he wa..."
links.text: "Well, it wasn't so much that he was expelled..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""He just quit coming. We haven't se..."
links.text: "He just quit coming. We haven't seen him around for weeks."

links.title: You: ""I've heard enough. Let's talk abou..."
links.text: "I've heard enough. Let's talk about something else."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Go ahead." The young man gives you..."
links.text: "Go ahead." The young man gives you a half-smile. His companion sniffs.

links.title: You: ""Shouldn't a group have, like, more..."
links.text: "Shouldn't a group have, like, more people in it?"

links.title: You: ""Two's all you need. Me and Kim are..."
links.text: "Two's all you need. Me and Kim are the same way." (Turn to Kim.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Kim and *I*..." the lieutenant mut..."
links.text: "Kim and *I*..." the lieutenant mutters under his breath. He scribbles something in his notebook but adds nothing else.

links.title: You: "(Point to the art supplies.) "What'..."
links.text: (Point to the art supplies.) "What's with the paint stuff?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "He sighs. "Yeah, it's hers. She jus..."
links.text: He sighs. "Yeah, it's hers. She just sort of... moved it all in a few months ago."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""She said if she's going to make tr..."
links.text: "She said if she's going to make truly radical art, she needs a suitably radical workspace."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""And I don't think she could afford..."
links.text: "And I don't think she could afford rent at an actual studio."

links.title: You: ""Do you like her art?""
links.text: "Do you like her art?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, sure. It's definitely *interes..."
links.text: "Oh, sure. It's definitely *interesting*, I would say..."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "'Interesting' -- isn't that just bi..."
links.text: 'Interesting' -- isn't that just binoclard for 'I don't have a real opinion'?

links.title: You: ""Wait, I thought 'interesting' was..."
links.text: "Wait, I thought 'interesting' was what people said when they don't have anything real to add?"

links.title: Echo Maker: "His companion's eyes widen with int..."
links.text: His companion's eyes widen with interest. He has a cold smile.

links.title: Logic: "If this is what the Union man meant..."
links.text: If this is what the Union man meant by theory combat, you've just scored a decisive blow.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Come on. It's not that I don't *ha..."
links.text: "Come on. It's not that I don't *have* anything to say about Cindy's art. It's more that I'm... still working out the details. It's a complex question, you've got to take your time with it..."

links.title: Empathy: "You've flustered the poor boy. Now..."
links.text: You've flustered the poor boy. Now he's *got* to say something.

links.title: Half Light: "It's like you sucker-punched him *w..."
links.text: It's like you sucker-punched him *with your words*.

links.title: You: "(Let it go.)"
links.text: (Let it go.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Hmmm, I guess you could call her l..."
links.text: "Hmmm, I guess you could call her latest stuff a sort of *counter-bourgeois calligraphy*. She's got a real taste for radical slogans."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It's too bad she hasn't developed..."
links.text: "It's too bad she hasn't developed the theoretical foundation to do truly radical work."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I think she'll get there, though...."
links.text: "I think she'll get there, though. She's still looking for a subject equal to her ambitions."

links.title: You: ""You want me to kick her out for yo..."
links.text: "You want me to kick her out for you? I've served an eviction or two recently."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I'm not sure it would do very much..."
links.text: "I'm not sure it would do very much good. She's sort of... impervious to authority."

links.title: Authority: "That's only because you haven't *re..."
links.text: That's only because you haven't *really* laid down the law with her yet.

links.title: Composure: "Seems unlikely you'll be able to 'l..."
links.text: Seems unlikely you'll be able to 'lay down the law' with a child who made you oink like a pig...

links.title: Authority: "Let's never bring up that shameful..."
links.text: Let's never bring up that shameful episode again.

links.title: Authority: "It's true. And let's not bring up t..."
links.text: It's true. And let's not bring up that shameful oinking episode.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Besides, it would look pretty bad..."
links.text: "Besides, it would look pretty bad if people thought we were collaborating with the gendarmerie."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No doubt.""
links.text: "No doubt."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Good point, Uli.""
links.text: "Good point, Uli."

links.title: You: ""Now I'm wondering, what's the deal..."
links.text: "Now I'm wondering, what's the deal with this place?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""'The deal'? At a fundamental level..."
links.text: "'The deal'? At a fundamental level I guess you could call it the shattered bones of a dream crushed by capital."

links.title: Logic: "A feeble and hopelessly mixed metap..."
links.text: A feeble and hopelessly mixed metaphor.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""That's really good, Steban. You sh..."
links.text: "That's really good, Steban. You should save that for an essay."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Thanks, Uli. When the idea is soun..."
links.text: "Thanks, Uli. When the idea is sound the words just sort of flow."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes, now keep developing the idea."
links.text: Yes, now keep developing the idea.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I think that's a mixed m..."
links.text: "Actually, I think that's a mixed metaphor."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Hmph. Leave it to the gendarme to..."
links.text: "Hmph. Leave it to the gendarme to enforce bourgeois stylistic values."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Besides, it's just a first draft.""
links.text: "Besides, it's just a first draft."

links.title: You: ""If this place is the shattered bon..."
links.text: "If this place is the shattered bones, that must make us the bone weevils."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Mmm, yeah that's not bad.""
links.text: "Mmm, yeah that's not bad."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Not as good as Steban's original i..."
links.text: "Not as good as Steban's original idea, though."

links.title: You: ""I heard these used to be luxury ap..."
links.text: "I heard these used to be luxury apartments. Million reál views, that sort of thing."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That could be." He nods. "It would..."
links.text: "That could be." He nods. "It would explain some of the more ornate detailing. But we're speaking in world-historical terms here. What this place *represents*, not what it merely *was*."

links.title: Echo Maker: "His friend yawns, evidently bored b..."
links.text: His friend yawns, evidently bored by literal reality.

links.title: You: ""Okay, but what *is* this place?""
links.text: "Okay, but what *is* this place?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's an old construction site." He..."
links.text: "It's an old construction site." He looks around. "They've been trying to restore these apartments for years, but as you can see they haven't made much progress."

links.title: You: ""Okay, let's move on.""
links.text: "Okay, let's move on."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "He sighs. "That's Cindy's stuff. Sh..."
links.text: He sighs. "That's Cindy's stuff. She just sort of... moved it all in a few months ago."

links.title: You: ""What were you doing with those mat..."
links.text: "What were you doing with those matchboxes just now?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man frowns at the little..."
links.text: The young man frowns at the little pile of boxes on the floor.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Nothing, just messing around until..."
links.text: "Nothing, just messing around until the meeting started."

links.title: Interfacing: "They're watching those matchboxes a..."
links.text: They're watching those matchboxes awfully intently for two guys who are just 'messing around.'

links.title: Interfacing: "It's almost as though they were try..."
links.text: It's almost as though they were trying to create the most unstable structure they could...

links.title: Logic: "With predictable results."
links.text: With predictable results.

links.title: You: ""The matchboxes... you were trying..."
links.text: "The matchboxes... you were trying to make the tower from Nilsen's journals."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""So you really *did* read all the w..."
links.text: "So you really *did* read all the way to the end." A sheepish grin. "Yeah, Uli and I were trying to see whether there was enough plasm between the two of us to hold up a few matchboxes..."

links.title: Empathy: "Saying it out loud makes him realis..."
links.text: Saying it out loud makes him realise how foolish it sounds.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It was just a little *informal* ex..."
links.text: "It was just a little *informal* experiment. No reason to take it too seriously."

links.title: You: ""We should try again, all of us.""
links.text: "We should try again, all of us."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man looks at you a moment..."
links.text: The young man looks at you a moment, then at his companion.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""What could it hurt? Alright, let's..."
links.text: "What could it hurt? Alright, let's give it another go..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'll sit this one out. I don't thi..."
links.text: "I'll sit this one out. I don't think you want my *skeptical materialism* interfering..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Before long, a modest tower begins..."
links.text: Before long, a modest tower begins to rise from the pile of matchboxes...

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "You place every box with the utmost..."
links.text: You place every box with the utmost delicacy and precision.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Easy, Uli...""
links.text: "Easy, Uli..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It's holding, it's holding...""
links.text: "It's holding, it's holding..."

links.title: Logic: "For the moment."
links.text: For the moment.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The higher the tower goes, the quie..."
links.text: The higher the tower goes, the quieter the room seems to become. Aside from the occasional comment, the three of you are completely absorbed by the task.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Alright. You go next, Steban.""
links.text: "Alright. You go next, Steban."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man pushes back his shirt..."
links.text: The young man pushes back his shirt sleeves, revealing the pale flesh of his forearms.

links.title: You: ""Easy now...""
links.text: "Easy now..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Is it... it's holding... it's hold..."
links.text: "Is it... it's holding... it's holding!"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Yes. This is the closest we've eve..."
links.text: "Yes. This is the closest we've ever gotten."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's almost exactly as Nilsen's ske..."
links.text: It's almost exactly as Nilsen's sketch imagined, a physical manifestation of the dialectical spiral of history.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Alright, gendarme, your turn.""
links.text: "Alright, gendarme, your turn."

links.title: Interfacing: "You've got this. Theories aside, th..."
links.text: You've got this. Theories aside, they're only matchboxes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Even the lieutenant is watching int..."
links.text: Even the lieutenant is watching intently now.

links.title: You: ""This is tall enough, better not to..."
links.text: "This is tall enough, better not to risk it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What are you talking about, detect..."
links.text: "What are you talking about, detective? You can't give up *now*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Come on, gendarme. Real progress r..."
links.text: "Come on, gendarme. Real progress requires great risks."

links.title: You: ""Ghost of Mazov, give me strength....."
links.text: "Ghost of Mazov, give me strength..." (Proceed.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's... it's...""
Steban, the Student Communist: ""My god, is it really holding?""
links.text: "My god, is it really holding?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It is, it is...""
links.text: "It is, it is..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There, in the middle of the floor,..."
links.text: There, in the middle of the floor, the winding spire quivers with an improbable energy...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is impossible, right? There's..."
links.text: "This is impossible, right? There's no way it's really staying up like that..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "But it is! It is!"
links.text: But it is! It is!

links.title: Rhetoric: "For a long moment, no one says a wo..."
links.text: For a long moment, no one says a word. You're all three transfixed.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""...""
Steban, the Student Communist: ""...""
Steban, the Student Communist: ""...""
Shivers: "A low pressure system is gathering..."
links.text: A low pressure system is gathering itself over the bay. It's begun to tug violently at the tarpaulins...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...""
Steban, the Student Communist: ""... and there it goes...""
links.text: "... and there it goes..."

links.title: You: ""That was weird.""
links.text: "That was weird."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""No." He looks up. "It was exactly..."
links.text: "No." He looks up. "It was exactly what's *supposed* to happen. We should treat it that way."

links.title: You: ""That was miraculous.""
links.text: "That was miraculous."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""That was remarkable.""
links.text: "That was remarkable."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""...""
You: ""... what do we do now?""
links.text: "... what do we do now?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Shhh. This is the most amazing thi..."
links.text: "Shhh. This is the most amazing thing I've ever seen..."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There's no way it should stay up li..."
links.text: There's no way it should stay up like that. How is the weight being distributed?

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""...""
Echo Maker: ""...""
You: ""Shit.""
links.text: "Shit."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""For a second there I thought we ha..."
links.text: "For a second there I thought we had it. Just goes to show how constrained we are under the limits of the prevailing regime."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Undoubtedly.""
links.text: "Undoubtedly."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Alternatively, it could be that ou..."
links.text: "Alternatively, it could be that our own ideological fervour is still *insufficient*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, the problem is almost certain..."
links.text: "Yes, the problem is almost certainly your *lack of commitment*, and not, say, gravity."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Harder to believe, but still possi..."
links.text: "Harder to believe, but still possible..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Either way, that's enough parlour..."
links.text: "Either way, that's enough parlour games for one night. Thanks for humouring us."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""We should probably clean up...""
links.text: "We should probably clean up..."

links.title: You: ""Fuck.""
links.text: "Fuck."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry.""
links.text: "I'm sorry."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Don't apologise. As I was saying,..."
links.text: "Don't apologise. As I was saying, if it were *easy*, it wouldn't require so much plasm to work."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, it may be that we've found t..."
links.text: "Well, it may be that we've found the outermost limit of our capabilities under the prevailing regime."

links.title: You: "Take a deep breath. (Proceed.)"
links.text: Take a deep breath. (Proceed.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Aaagh! Shit!""
links.text: "Aaagh! Shit!"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It's alright, Steban. That was sti..."
links.text: "It's alright, Steban. That was still *very* close. One of our best performances yet."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant says nothing, but hi..."
links.text: The lieutenant says nothing, but his expression suggests otherwise.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Damn it to hell!""
links.text: "Damn it to hell!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant says nothing, but a..."
links.text: The lieutenant says nothing, but a bemused grin crosses his face.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It's my fault, Steban. My hands we..."
links.text: "It's my fault, Steban. My hands were shaking... Nerves got the better of me."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's fine, Uli. That's enough parl..."
links.text: "It's fine, Uli. That's enough parlour games for one night. We should clean up."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, I think we're probably finis..."
links.text: "Well, I think we're probably finished here, detective."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Yes, it's probably time for you to..."
links.text: Yes, it's probably time for you to take your leave as well.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Right. Basically an infra-material..."
links.text: "Right. Basically an infra-materialist parlour game. Let's forget about it."

links.title: Interfacing: "The charge in the air has changed...."
links.text: The charge in the air has changed. You allow the moment to pass.

links.title: You: ""Do I *know* you two from somewhere?""
links.text: "Do I *know* you two from somewhere?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""*You've* read our article?" For th..."
links.text: "*You've* read our article?" For the first time since you've met the young man, words seem to desert him...

links.title: Echo Maker: ""That I did not expect." His compan..."
links.text: "That I did not expect." His companion is blushing now, a sheepish grin on his face.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The energy in the room has shifted..."
links.text: The energy in the room has shifted ever so slightly in your favour. They're afraid they've somehow *embarrassed* themselves in front of you.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, don't keep us on tenterhooks..."
links.text: "Well, don't keep us on tenterhooks! What did you think of the essay?"

links.title: Empathy: "The delicate egos on these boys! Ev..."
links.text: The delicate egos on these boys! Even though you're just some cop they're desperate for your approval.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Hey! You're not just 'some cop', yo..."
links.text: Hey! You're not just 'some cop', you've got highly developed critical faculties! Now's your chance to show them off.

links.title: You: "(Show them your edits.) "I actually..."
links.text: (Show them your edits.) "I actually had a few pieces of constructive criticism..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man takes the folded up m..."
links.text: The young man takes the folded up magazine with some hesitation. As he reads over your annotations and emendations a look of deep concentration comes over his face...

links.title: Empathy: "He has the look of a man spread nak..."
links.text: He has the look of a man spread naked on the operating table. He can feel the cool metal of the scalpel, the bracing sting of the antiseptic, and yet his expression isn't wholly unpleasant. A part of him actually seems to *enjoy* the attention.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""What does it say, Steban? I can't..."
links.text: "What does it say, Steban? I can't see."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""They're... good notes. A little br..."
links.text: "They're... good notes. A little brutal on questions of style, but he's not *wrong* about any of it..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Would it be alright if I kept this..."
links.text: "Would it be alright if I kept this for a while? I'd just like some time to think about your comments." He turns to you.

links.title: You: ""Sure, you hang onto it.""
links.text: "Sure, you hang onto it."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Thanks, I appreciate it.""
links.text: "Thanks, I appreciate it."

links.title: You: ""No, that's my only copy.""
links.text: "No, that's my only copy."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Sure, right. I got the main idea a..."
links.text: "Sure, right. I got the main idea anyway."

links.title: You: ""To be honest, it doesn't sound lik..."
links.text: "To be honest, it doesn't sound like you know anything about motor racing."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, I hope you'll let us know wh..."
links.text: "Well, I hope you'll let us know when *your* monograph is coming out..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""I bet he's never written a substan..."
links.text: "I bet he's never written a substantial essay himself. He's really got no right to critique. None at all."

links.title: Empathy: "Well, there you did it. You stung t..."
links.text: Well, there you did it. You stung them, and to what end?

links.title: You: ""It sounded like a recycled univers..."
links.text: "It sounded like a recycled university essay, frankly."

links.title: You: ""I liked the parts about death and..."
links.text: "I liked the parts about death and dismemberment. That's what racing's all about."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, yes, that's the crux of our..."
links.text: "Well, yes, that's the crux of our thesis. Ulixes is especially interested in capitalist violence."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Really just violence in general. I..."
links.text: "Really just violence in general. I find it *fascinating*."

links.title: Half Light: "Something about this one makes you..."
links.text: Something about this one makes you want to avoid dark alleys at night...

links.title: You: ""It was a good article. You should..."
links.text: "It was a good article. You should keep developing your ideas."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, of course that's just an *in..."
links.text: "Well, of course that's just an *initial foray* into the subject. We're hoping to return to it for a more substantial treatment next term..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""In any case, I'm glad our piece fo..."
links.text: "In any case, I'm glad our piece found its audience. That's always the hope with these things, you know."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Time to meet these two on the intel..."
links.text: Time to meet these two on the intellectual battlefield. Why don't you show off those highly developed critical faculties of yours?

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I don't think so."  The young man..."
links.text: "I don't think so."  The young man gives you a curious look. "Unless you've been hanging around the Cultural Studies faculty at the École Normale de Revachol..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Perhaps he subscribes to 'La Fumée..."
links.text: "Perhaps he subscribes to 'La Fumée'."

links.title: Empathy: "That's sarcasm. He does not expect..."
links.text: That's sarcasm. He does not expect you to subscribe to radical communist periodicals.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Of course! They're the ones who pro..."
links.text: Of course! They're the ones who produced that overwrought *critique* of TipTop Tournée.

links.title: You: ""Aha, you two wrote the piece about..."
links.text: "Aha, you two wrote the piece about motor carriage racing."

links.title: You: "(Show them 'La Fumée'.) "Wait, *you..."
links.text: (Show them 'La Fumée'.) "Wait, *you* guys wrote for *this*?"

links.title: You: ""Is the reading group accepting new..."
links.text: "Is the reading group accepting new members?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We typically only accept new membe..."
links.text: "We typically only accept new members once per semester. There's this whole *process*, with essays and presentations on assigned topics..." The young man turns to his companion.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But given that we have some extra..."
links.text: "But given that we have some extra seating at the moment, I guess we could be convinced to expedite an application or two."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Steban, you can't be serious... fo..."
links.text: "Steban, you can't be serious... for a gendarme?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I am serious. As materialists we'v..."
links.text: "I am serious. As materialists we've got to adapt to conditions as they are. Besides, he'll still need to pass the *interview portion* of the entrance process..." He turns back to you.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... assuming he's even still inter..."
links.text: "... assuming he's even still interested, that is."

links.title: You: "Convince them you belong in the rea..."
links.text: Convince them you belong in the reading group.

links.title: Composure: "What's there to be scared of? You'v..."
links.text: What's there to be scared of? You've really been cracking the books these last few days. You can go toe-to-intellectual-toe with any reading group in Martinaise...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You've spent a not inconsiderable a..."
links.text: You've spent a not inconsiderable amount of time arranging the works in your mental library by theme and period. All the ideas and references you'll need are ready-at-hand.

links.title: Composure: "Take a deep breath. You've done som..."
links.text: Take a deep breath. You've done some reading these past few days. But you also know there's more to life than what you find in books...

links.title: Endurance: "You've survived things these kids c..."
links.text: You've survived things these kids can't even imagine. They've got nothing on you.

links.title: Composure: "Remember: Where most people go wron..."
links.text: Remember: Where most people go wrong is in thinking they have to hide what they don't know...

links.title: Empathy: "Another thing, these young men have..."
links.text: Another thing, these young men have the most exquisitely tuned insecurity receptors you've ever witnessed.

links.title: Composure: "Now, chin up. You've got this."
links.text: Now, chin up. You've got this.

links.title: You: ""This is just the group I've been l..."
links.text: "This is just the group I've been looking for. When do we start?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, you want to start *now*?" He l..."
links.text: "Oh, you want to start *now*?" He looks to his companion, then back at you. "Sure, we can manage that..."

links.title: Composure: "You've caught him off-balance. The..."
links.text: You've caught him off-balance. The momentum is already in your favour.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Go ahead and take a seat. Since we..."
links.text: "Go ahead and take a seat. Since we haven't had time to prepare an exhaustive questionnaire, I think we can keep this interview more freeform."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Why don't you tell us a bit about..."
links.text: "Why don't you tell us a bit about the books you're interested in, and we'll just see where the conversation goes."

links.title: You: ""Like you guys, I really get into p..."
links.text: "Like you guys, I really get into political and historical subjects."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Absolutely. It's the only proper f..."
links.text: "Absolutely. It's the only proper foundation to develop a real understanding of events." He nods in vigorous agreement.

links.title: You: ""There might be something to that...."
links.text: "There might be something to that. I recently finished 'The Greatest Innocence'."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Hmm, don't think I'm familiar with..."
links.text: "Hmm, don't think I'm familiar with it. Give us a quick summary, if you don't mind."

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. You quickly gloss Lopez de Fuego's essential argument, peppering it with your own commentary and asides...

links.title: Empathy: "Like a river emptying into the sea,..."
links.text: Like a river emptying into the sea, the discussion winds its way toward the character of the innocence herself.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... but then, any *critical* accou..."
links.text: "... but then, any *critical* account of Dolores Dei's reign has to seriously reckon with her atrocities in Magritania and La Vuelta during the Mesque secession, don't you think?"

links.title: You: ""Lopez de Fuego seemed to think she..."
links.text: "Lopez de Fuego seemed to think she was pretty great regardless."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Total nonsense. The greatest thing..."
links.text: "Total nonsense. The greatest thing Dolores Dei ever did was get blasted by her own therrier."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""If he wants a real critical histor..."
links.text: "If he wants a real critical history, he's got to read 'On the Material Conditions of the Mirovan Boilermakers'."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's so good. Brutally revelatory.""
links.text: "It's so good. Brutally revelatory."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""In any case, I think we've heard e..."
links.text: "In any case, I think we've heard enough. We could use someone with your perspective in the group. With just a bit more theoretical foundation, I think you'll be making real contributions."

links.title: Composure: "These kids are eating out of your h..."
links.text: These kids are eating out of your hand, practically. Another quarter of an hour disappears. The questions come rapid-fire, but you have an answer for every one.

links.title: Composure: "Now, you can sense things starting..."
links.text: Now, you can sense things starting to slow down. The interview must be reaching an inflection point...

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I did get the impression..."
links.text: "Honestly, I did get the impression there was something inhuman about her."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""The whole innocentic system practi..."
links.text: "The whole innocentic system practically requires that. Without true gods we're made to set them up for ourselves." He nods vigorously.

links.title: You: ""Exactly. Lopez de Fuego totally gl..."
links.text: "Exactly. Lopez de Fuego totally glosses over all her mass murder."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Ha! It's good you were able to see..."
links.text: "Ha! It's good you were able to see through even that gauzy nostalgic pulp."

links.title: You: ""I'm a little rusty on my innocenti..."
links.text: "I'm a little rusty on my innocentic history, so it was helpful for me."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I'll say that beginnings are very..."
links.text: "I'll say that beginnings are very delicate things. That makes it all the more important that you start with *the right books*."

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. You quickly gloss Lopez de Fuego's essential argument, peppering it with your own commentary and asides...

links.title: You: ""That reminds me, Kim and I just pl..."
links.text: "That reminds me, Kim and I just played this interesting game, 'Suzerainty'."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, right. We've been meaning to t..."
links.text: "Oh, right. We've been meaning to try that out."

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. Soon you're engaged in a thoughtful back-and-forth about the relationship between theme and mechanics...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Best of all, your arguments are lib..."
links.text: Best of all, your arguments are liberally seasoned with references to particular historical events and personages.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... but then my issue with these h..."
links.text: "... but then my issue with these historical cube-pushers is that they offer the *illusion* of subjectivity even as they reinscribe the logic of colonialism itself..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... though I'd love to hear your t..."
links.text: "... though I'd love to hear your take on it."

links.title: You: ""For me, games are mostly about spe..."
links.text: "For me, games are mostly about spending time with a partner."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's only saying that because he g..."
links.text: "He's only saying that because he got the better of me, somehow..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm. What is it they say about tie..."
links.text: "Hmm. What is it they say about ties? That they're like kissing your sister... or in this case, I suppose, your partner."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's only saying that because he *..."
links.text: "He's only saying that because he *likes* getting thrashed like a schoolboy."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, and it only took about four h..."
links.text: "Yes, and it only took about four hours of our lives that we'll never get back."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""With his 'partner', he says.""
links.text: "With his 'partner', he says."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Listen, this is a forward-thinking..."
links.text: "Listen, this is a forward-thinking group. It's entirely your business, of course."

links.title: You: ""But by allowing players to *recrea..."
links.text: "But by allowing players to *recreate* historical events, like the introduction of cocaine to Safre, doesn't it force them to question what 'subjectivity' means in a ludo-thematic context?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Interesting. So you're saying that..."
links.text: "Interesting. So you're saying that in a certain sense the *game plays the players* as much as they play the game?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Hmm. Then what does that make the..."
links.text: "Hmm. Then what does that make the *game designers*?"

links.title: You: ""Superstars.""
links.text: "Superstars."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Anyway, we also enjoy a good board..."
links.text: "Anyway, we also enjoy a good board game every once in a while. The other week Ulixes and I tried this new one where everyone is competing to manage their own Zone of Ecological Catastrophe. You should see the components."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""The irradiated waste tokens have t..."
links.text: "The irradiated waste tokens have this great metallic ochre sheen."

links.title: You: ""Malevolent deities.""
links.text: "Malevolent deities."

links.title: You: ""Just people working a job, like an..."
links.text: "Just people working a job, like any other."

links.title: You: ""I thought it was pretty fun. No ne..."
links.text: "I thought it was pretty fun. No need to intellectualise it too much."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Of course. The one thing capitalis..."
links.text: "Of course. The one thing capitalism does better than every other ideology is novel and clever distractions. It's all one never-ending dopamine dripper."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Capitalism *rules*, is what he seem..."
links.text: Capitalism *rules*, is what he seems to be saying.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Drip after drip after drip after d..."
links.text: "Drip after drip after drip after drip..." The young man's companion appears to be mashing his fist into his palm.

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. Soon you're engaged in a thoughtful back-and-forth about the relationship between theme and mechanics...

links.title: You: ""But once you've got a political le..."
links.text: "But once you've got a political lens, you can read anything critically. Even those Hjelmdallermann books."
