links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Interesting. Say more about that...""
links.text: "Interesting. Say more about that..."

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. Soon you're in a lively back and forth on the political substrata of the Hjelmdallermann universe...

links.title: Half Light: "Even if they won't admit it, these..."
links.text: Even if they won't admit it, these two love blood and sex as much as anyone.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... but don't you think that porno..."
links.text: "... but don't you think that pornographic fascist mythology gets pretty tiresome after a few books?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "He nods to your shirt. "No offence,..."
links.text: He nods to your shirt. "No offence, of course."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Let them know your interest in musc..."
links.text: Let them know your interest in muscleman literature is much more high-minded than they're giving you credit for.

links.title: You: ""Oh, certainement. I'm more interes..."
links.text: "Oh, certainement. I'm more interested in them as cultural artifacts."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Ah, well there's certainly value i..."
links.text: "Ah, well there's certainly value in that kind of reading. Comrade Mazov says something on that note in his collected speeches..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""'To find victory in the cultural w..."
links.text: "'To find victory in the cultural war we must first scout the battlefield'."

links.title: You: ""No way, I live for that kind of st..."
links.text: "No way, I live for that kind of stuff."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Ha! Of course you do. I just hope..."
links.text: "Ha! Of course you do. I just hope when you're reading it you've got a sturdy pair of gloves on..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Can't let any of the dreck rub off..."
links.text: "Can't let any of the dreck rub off on you."

links.title: You: ""Nah, it's just good escapist fun.""
links.text: "Nah, it's just good escapist fun."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, sure, we don't mean to deny th..."
links.text: "Oh, sure, we don't mean to deny the value of *pleasure* in reading."

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. Soon you're in a lively back and forth on the political substrata of the Hjelmdallermann universe...

links.title: You: ""Listen, books are fine and all, bu..."
links.text: "Listen, books are fine and all, but to be straight with you, they're no substitute for a real story."

links.title: You: ""For me, it's more about finding th..."
links.text: "For me, it's more about finding the right thing for the right moment."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""We prefer difficult books. Books t..."
links.text: "We prefer difficult books. Books that might destroy you, if you don't destroy them first."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's enough, Uli. It's the genda..."
links.text: "That's enough, Uli. It's the gendarme's opinions we're interested in."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... but to Comrade Ulixes' point,..."
links.text: "... but to Comrade Ulixes' point, isn't there value in reading really difficult books, just for the sheer challenge of it?"

links.title: You: ""I tried reading this extremely dep..."
links.text: "I tried reading this extremely depressing Graadian novel."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, right. 'Sixteen Days of Coldes..."
links.text: "Oh, right. 'Sixteen Days of Coldest... Whatever'. What was your take on it?"

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. You ably summarise the novel's characters and themes...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Even better, you're able to connect..."
links.text: Even better, you're able to connect those themes to your critique of the novel's formal qualities, such as they are.

links.title: You: ""... so anyway I had to give up. Th..."
links.text: "... so anyway I had to give up. There was no point in subjecting myself to needless suffering."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's no wonder you couldn't finish..."
links.text: "It's no wonder you couldn't finish it. Sounds like turgid bourgeois social realism." He nods approvingly.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""And Graadian realism is the worst..."
links.text: "And Graadian realism is the worst realism. It's nearly as bad as Gottwaldian critical theory."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Makes you want to gouge your eyes..."
links.text: "Makes you want to gouge your eyes out. Or better, gouge the author's eyes out."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""In any case, I think we've heard e..."
links.text: "In any case, I think we've heard enough. We could use someone with your perspective in the group. With just a bit more theoretical foundation, I think you'll be making real contributions."

links.title: Composure: "These kids are eating out of your h..."
links.text: These kids are eating out of your hand, practically. Another quarter of an hour disappears. The questions come rapid-fire, but you have an answer for every one.

links.title: Composure: "Now, you can sense things starting..."
links.text: Now, you can sense things starting to slow down. The interview must be reaching an inflection point...

links.title: You: ""... but eventually I finished it,..."
links.text: "... but eventually I finished it, however much physical pain it caused me."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Sounds to me like a typical bourge..."
links.text: "Sounds to me like a typical bourgeois social novel, designed to assuage the egos of frustrated housewives and win international awards."

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. You ably summarise the novel's characters and themes...

links.title: You: ""To be honest, these days I prefer..."
links.text: "To be honest, these days I prefer escapist stuff, like classic Dick Mullen."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I'm sure as a gendarme you have a..."
links.text: "I'm sure as a gendarme you have a *very* interesting take on the Mullen character."

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. This is your area of expertise, after all...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "That's right. These two young men n..."
links.text: That's right. These two young men naturally defer to your aura of authority, which you nevertheless wear as lightly as your halogen watermarks.

links.title: Conceptualization: "This is your chance to show off you..."
links.text: This is your chance to show off your own critical faculties. Show them what an *introspective* cop looks like!

links.title: You: ""... but in the end Mullen is a ref..."
links.text: "... but in the end Mullen is a reflection of a politico-legal institution that's irreconcilably divided between protecting 'the people' and defending the material interests of capital."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant doesn't speak, but y..."
links.text: The lieutenant doesn't speak, but you believe you detect a slight widening of his eyes, as though he never expected such a cogent thought to emerge from your mouth.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""A compelling point, for sure. We'd..."
links.text: "A compelling point, for sure. We'd probably be better off if more police officers learned to think so reflectively about their social function."

links.title: You: ""... but really I just like him bec..."
links.text: "... but really I just like him because I'm a cop too, you know?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Makes sense. It's natural to seek..."
links.text: "Makes sense. It's natural to seek out reflections of your own experience in literature when the politico-economic system doesn't permit genuine self-realization."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But at least crime literature *as..."
links.text: "But at least crime literature *as a genre* is able to engage with the systemic failures of capitalism."

links.title: You: ""... but then the whole book fell a..."
links.text: "... but then the whole book fell apart before I could solve the mystery..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's an unfortunate quality of p..."
links.text: "That's an unfortunate quality of pulp fiction. Much of it is written to be disposable both on an intellectual *and* a material level."

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. This is your area of expertise, after all...

links.title: You: ""I'm more into works of pure imagin..."
links.text: "I'm more into works of pure imagination, like 'Wirrâl'."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Wait, you play 'Wirrâl'?""
links.text: "Wait, you play 'Wirrâl'?"

links.title: Empathy: "And just like that, all trace of ir..."
links.text: And just like that, all trace of irony drains from his voice.

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. Soon you're all animatedly debating the political subtext of character creation...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Come on, let's *really* impress the..."
links.text: Come on, let's *really* impress them. Overturn the *race-class paradigm*. The more esoteric, the better.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... I'm just saying it's *heavily..."
links.text: "... I'm just saying it's *heavily implied* that welkin are the bourgeoisie of the Wirrâl setting..."

links.title: You: ""But *humans* have all the most rea..."
links.text: "But *humans* have all the most reactionary skill specialities."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's a fair point. Personally, I..."
links.text: "That's a fair point. Personally, I've never understood the point of picking a human in the Wirrâl setting, but to each their own."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Completely counter to the spirit o..."
links.text: "Completely counter to the spirit of 'Wirrâl'. What's even the point?"

links.title: You: ""Right, which is why the *dweorgr*..."
links.text: "Right, which is why the *dweorgr* are definitely the labouring class."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""There's no doubt about it." He nod..."
links.text: "There's no doubt about it." He nods. "I just wish they had more flexibility with their sub-races."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""I still like the hill dweorgr for..."
links.text: "I still like the hill dweorgr for their Master Ironworking feat."

links.title: You: ""I just don't understand why welkin..."
links.text: "I just don't understand why welkin get all the coolest sub-races."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I do hope they revise it in the ne..."
links.text: "I do hope they revise it in the next edition. But for now, I'm quite proud of the high welkin I built for our most recent campaign."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Steban's welkin is so mega. He's g..."
links.text: "Steban's welkin is so mega. He's got this umbral stave that gives him *ungodly* bonuses against shadowborn."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's pretty awesome, I won't deny..."
links.text: "It's pretty awesome, I won't deny it."

links.title: You: ""I reject the race-class paradigm...."
links.text: "I reject the race-class paradigm. My personal build is a highly experimental *welkin-pygmy hybrid*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Combining the best race with the w..."
links.text: "Combining the best race with the worst race... Not sure about the skill progressions, but I bet the role-playing opportunities are *wild*."

links.title: Echo Maker: "The young man's companion says noth..."
links.text: The young man's companion says nothing, but the expression on his face reveals a begrudging respect for your experimental approach to character creation.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But seriously, the next campaign,..."
links.text: "But seriously, the next campaign, you've got to be there. I need to see this hybrid in action."

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. Soon you're all animatedly debating the political subtext of character creation...

links.title: You: ""Listen, books are fine and all, bu..."
links.text: "Listen, books are fine and all, but to be straight with you, they're no substitute for a real story."

links.title: You: ""I'm more into practical books. Boo..."
links.text: "I'm more into practical books. Books that help me understand the real world."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Aha, a real old-school pedestrian..."
links.text: "Aha, a real old-school pedestrian materialist. Alright, we'll play along..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""So what sort of practical works ar..."
links.text: "So what sort of practical works are we talking about?"

links.title: You: ""I enjoy thinking about truly funda..."
links.text: "I enjoy thinking about truly fundamental concepts, like the alphabet for instance."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Hmm, so you're saying you've got t..."
links.text: "Hmm, so you're saying you've got to have a certain practical foundation before you move onto more abstract topics. Okay, I'm following..."

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. Soon you're subjecting even the alphabet to a meticulous archaeologico-materialist critique.

links.title: You: ""... but even abstractions as basic..."
links.text: "... but even abstractions as basic as letterforms must have *some* origin in material reality..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's true. I recall from one of..."
links.text: "That's true. I recall from one of psycholinguistics lectures that the letter 'A' is derived from the proto-Perikarnassian glyph meant to represent a reed hut."

links.title: You: ""That's in contrast with the Intern..."
links.text: "That's in contrast with the International Language, which connects each letter to an abstraction."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""A fair point. It also reminds me o..."
links.text: "A fair point. It also reminds me of one of Mazov and Nilsen's unrealized projects, a universal system of communist pictographs, one that would allow revolutionaries to communicate and organise across any language barrier."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Good god, have we really been talk..."
links.text: "Good god, have we really been talking about the alphabet for a quarter hour?"  He looks down at his watch.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It appears so.""
links.text: "It appears so."

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. Soon you're subjecting even the alphabet to a meticulous archaeologico-materialist critique.

links.title: You: ""I can't say how reliable it is, bu..."
links.text: "I can't say how reliable it is, but I did just read a book on pale-centric medicine."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Interesting, I always thought that..."
links.text: "Interesting, I always thought that stuff was common folk superstitions repackaged as bourgeois spiritualism, but maybe I've been overly dismissive?"

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. Soon you're debating whether a de-commodified spirituality is even possible under capitalism...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Probably not, is the answer. Which..."
links.text: Probably not, is the answer. Which isn't to say it isn't *sometimes* still useful.

links.title: You: ""... but in the end I did learn how..."
links.text: "... but in the end I did learn how to make a poultice..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh? Sounds nice, actually. Comrade..."
links.text: "Oh? Sounds nice, actually. Comrade Mazov himself preferred chamomile tea, as I'm sure you're aware."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Grain spirits are dangerous. That'..."
links.text: "Grain spirits are dangerous. That's why Comrade Mazov himself preferred chamomile tea, as I'm sure you're aware."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""To be perfectly honest, 'poultice'..."
links.text: "To be perfectly honest, 'poultice' is one of those words I see around, but I have no idea what it means."

links.title: You: ""... anyway it mostly seems like a..."
links.text: "... anyway it mostly seems like a way to bilk desperate people for money when they don't have access to real healthcare..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""A Gottwaldian would tell you that..."
links.text: "A Gottwaldian would tell you that it's an inescapable fact of modernity that we can only repackage our collective history in increasingly ludicrous forms..."  He nods.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Thank god we're no Gottwaldians.""
links.text: "Thank god we're no Gottwaldians."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""In any case, I think we've heard e..."
links.text: "In any case, I think we've heard enough. We could use someone with your perspective in the group. With just a bit more theoretical foundation, I think you'll be making real contributions."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Yes, I would say he's got serious..."
links.text: "Yes, I would say he's got serious potential at least."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Besides, it's inconceivable that w..."
links.text: "Besides, it's inconceivable that we'd turn down a fellow Wirrâl enthusiast..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""And with that, welcome to the most..."
links.text: "And with that, welcome to the most ideologically advanced materialist reading group in Martinaise!"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Here's your first assignment. It's..."
links.text: "Here's your first assignment. It's an overview of infra-materialist theory. A little basic, as you'll see, but one has to start somewhere."

links.title: You: ""Guess it's time to see what this '..."
links.text: "Guess it's time to see what this 'book' stuff is all about."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It's sweet how excited you are. Co..."
links.text: "It's sweet how excited you are. Come back when you're done. We'll be here pretty much every night after 22.00."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Do be sure to take your time with..."
links.text: "Do be sure to take your time with the reading. We'll be eager to hear your thoughts."

links.title: You: ""I'll add it to my very extensive r..."
links.text: "I'll add it to my very extensive reading list."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You're going to fit right in, I th..."
links.text: "You're going to fit right in, I think. Come back when you're done. We'll be here pretty much every night after 22.00."

links.title: You: "(Say nothing, just take the book.)"
links.text: (Say nothing, just take the book.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Come back when you're done." He gi..."
links.text: "Come back when you're done." He gives you a brief nod as he hands you the slim guide. "We'll be here pretty much every night after 22.00."

links.title: Composure: "These kids are eating out of your h..."
links.text: These kids are eating out of your hand, practically. Another quarter of an hour disappears. The questions come rapid-fire, but you have an answer for every one.

links.title: Composure: "Now, you can sense things starting..."
links.text: Now, you can sense things starting to slow down. The interview must be reaching an inflection point...

links.title: You: ""... but then I still don't really..."
links.text: "... but then I still don't really get what this whole 'pale' thing is about, so..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""There are so many theories out the..."
links.text: "There are so many theories out there, most of them ridiculous. But we'd be here all night if we tried to get into them."

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's better not to know, that's wha..."
links.text: It's better not to know, that's what the wind is telling you.

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. Soon you're debating whether a de-commodified spirituality is even possible under capitalism...

links.title: You: ""Just consider the cockatoo for ins..."
links.text: "Just consider the cockatoo for instance. How much do you really know about what they're like?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Cockatoos? Fascinating. So tell us..."
links.text: "Cockatoos? Fascinating. So tell us what you gathered from your ornithological researches."

links.title: Composure: "Now's your chance to end this inter..."
links.text: Now's your chance to end this interview on a high-note. This is a subject where *you* hold all the advantages...

links.title: You: ""... and that's how I discovered my..."
links.text: "... and that's how I discovered my heraldic bird."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I have to say, I never realised hu..."
links.text: "I have to say, I never realised humans and cockatoos had so much in common."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""It makes sense, though. Mazovianis..."
links.text: "It makes sense, though. Mazovianism stresses the essential continuity between humanity and nature, so anything you find in one should be reflected in the other. What's the exact quote, Uli?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""I believe it's 'Man is the mirror..."
links.text: "I believe it's 'Man is the mirror of the world'."

links.title: Composure: "This is a good start. They're start..."
links.text: This is a good start. They're starting to loosen up. You feel relaxed and in control. This is a subject where *you* hold all the advantages...

links.title: You: ""Listen, books are fine and all, bu..."
links.text: "Listen, books are fine and all, but to be straight with you, they're no substitute for a real story."

links.title: You: ""Look guys, I've gotta be honest. I..."
links.text: "Look guys, I've gotta be honest. I may not have 'read' many 'books', but that doesn't mean I don't have *stories*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Okay, we'll bite." The young man a..."
links.text: "Okay, we'll bite." The young man and his companion look at one another, then turn back to you. "What sort of stories are we talking about?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "A real-life procedural, complete wi..."
links.text: A real-life procedural, complete with gory details...

links.title: Drama: "How about a tale of adventure, intr..."
links.text: How about a tale of adventure, intrigue, and derring-do?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Give 'em sex and drugs! They're cle..."
links.text: Give 'em sex and drugs! They're clearly not getting any on their own.

links.title: You: ""Let's just say the human body star..."
links.text: "Let's just say the human body starts to do some weird things when it's been in a tree for seven days..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You've got our attention. Let's se..."
links.text: "You've got our attention. Let's see where this goes..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, I'm rather curious myself.""
links.text: "Yes, I'm rather curious myself."

links.title: Composure: "You've got them. They're starting t..."
links.text: You've got them. They're starting to loosen up. You're relaxed and in control. You deftly weave every piece of the story together...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "... even the lieutenant seems engro..."
links.text: ... even the lieutenant seems engrossed, despite your revealing details of an RCM investigation...

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... I'm just trying to imagine wha..."
links.text: "... I'm just trying to imagine what it would have been like had he died in the summer..."

links.title: You: ""Right, of course. I'm really talki..."
links.text: "Right, of course. I'm really talking about my top-notch forensics skills."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The work he did on the autopsy was..."
links.text: "The work he did on the autopsy was quite good, I can confirm."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""So have you figured out his real i..."
links.text: "So have you figured out his real identity?"

links.title: You: ""No, I mean literally.""
links.text: "No, I mean literally."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Ah, so there *is* a supra-natural..."
links.text: "Ah, so there *is* a supra-natural angle to this case..."

links.title: Composure: "Another quarter of an hour disappea..."
links.text: Another quarter of an hour disappears. The conversation bounces back and forth. Whatever their pretensions, it's clear these two have been craving something *real*.

links.title: Composure: "Now, you can sense things starting..."
links.text: Now, you can sense things starting to slow down. Time to wrap this tale up...

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... and we still don't know what h..."
links.text: "... and we still don't know what happened to the rest of his armour..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It will turn up, I'm sure. In a wa..."
links.text: "It will turn up, I'm sure. In a way, it wants to be found..."

links.title: You: ""Perhaps. But that thread of the st..."
links.text: "Perhaps. But that thread of the story is still unresolved..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I suppose we'll have to leave it t..."
links.text: "I suppose we'll have to leave it there. But listen, gendarme: We could use someone with your *breadth of expertise*. With just a little more theoretical background, I think you'll be able to make some real contributions."

links.title: You: ""... so anyway, my current theory i..."
links.text: "... so anyway, my current theory is that she's somewhere along the coast."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Makes sense. It doesn't seem like..."
links.text: "Makes sense. It doesn't seem like there's anywhere else she could have gone."

links.title: You: ""... so anyway, I think there's sti..."
links.text: "... so anyway, I think there's still a shot. But in the meantime I'm just focussing on my casework."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Makes sense. Based on my experienc..."
links.text: "Makes sense. Based on my experience, you've got to let her see that you've grown, ideologically speaking..."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "His "experience" with these matters..."
links.text: His "experience" with these matters is painfully limited, not that he realises it.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Steban's right. If it's going to h..."
links.text: "Steban's right. If it's going to happen, it will happen."

links.title: You: ""... but I've done some reflecting..."
links.text: "... but I've done some reflecting and these days I consider myself a feminist."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That's a fascinating trajectory, f..."
links.text: "That's a fascinating trajectory, for sure. It's good to hear that you can still grow ideologically even at an... um... advanced age."

links.title: Empathy: "They really have no idea how old yo..."
links.text: They really have no idea how old you are, much less what it means to age.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Yes, a fascinating case study...""
links.text: "Yes, a fascinating case study..."

links.title: You: ""... and anyway, even if you could..."
links.text: "... and anyway, even if you could somehow *unpeel* time, it wouldn't be the *you* you who gets rich from those investments..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""But that would imply that whenever..."
links.text: "But that would imply that whenever you unpeel time you leave behind some kind of *doppelgänger* in now-time..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good god, have we really been talk..."
links.text: "Good god, have we really been talking about 'unpeeling time' for a quarter hour?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not pretty. Eventually the force o..."
links.text: "Not pretty. Eventually the force of gravity would have caused the rest of the body to separate from the head. There would have been *very little* for us to work with..."

links.title: You: ""It would have been a mess, let me..."
links.text: "It would have been a mess, let me tell you. No way I would've been able to find the true cause of death..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Wait, are you saying the hanged ma..."
links.text: "Wait, are you saying the hanged man wasn't really *hanged*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "... even the lieutenant seems engro..."
links.text: ... even the lieutenant seems engrossed, despite your revealing details of an RCM investigation...

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... but I still don't see what the..."
links.text: "... but I still don't see what the lady driver had to do with the strike stand-off..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In all fairness, the whole situati..."
links.text: "In all fairness, the whole situation is rather complicated."

links.title: You: ""That's just it, though. She was ju..."
links.text: "That's just it, though. She was just one more pawn, just like how the Wild Pines rep tried to play me."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Clearly there's a lot of ins-and-o..."
links.text: "Clearly there's a lot of ins-and-outs. It almost reminds me of a Dick Mullen novel."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I'm still trying to piece th..."
links.text: "Yeah, I'm still trying to piece the whole thing together, but I can't get it to add up yet."

links.title: You: ""I'm not even sure there *is* a con..."
links.text: "I'm not even sure there *is* a connection, but I needed to get the Pines' cooperation *somehow*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Ah, right. You were playing the lo..."
links.text: "Ah, right. You were playing the long game."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... so is it typical for men of yo..."
links.text: "... so is it typical for men of your background to use that, um, formulation?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A great question.""
links.text: "A great question."

links.title: You: ""No, my brain came up with that all..."
links.text: "No, my brain came up with that all by itself."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Perhaps some vestigial sexual obje..."
links.text: "Perhaps some vestigial sexual objectification from your pre-revolutionary consciousness." He nods.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It happens to the best of us.""
links.text: "It happens to the best of us."

links.title: You: ""It's embarrassing, but at that poi..."
links.text: "It's embarrassing, but at that point my political consciousness was still pretty rudimentary."

links.title: You: ""You know, in a weird way, I think..."
links.text: "You know, in a weird way, I think she was into it."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""So you're saying it didn't suck to..."
links.text: "So you're saying it didn't suck to interrogate her later? I find that unlikely..."

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I think the main problem..."
links.text: "Honestly, I think the main problem was my shirt. If it had been just a *little* cleaner, I probably could've pulled it off."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Strange. I thought that women were..."
links.text: "Strange. I thought that women were attracted to a certain amount of revolutionary musk..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Maybe it's a question of degree.""
links.text: "Maybe it's a question of degree."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I'm just trying to imagine what it..."
links.text: "I'm just trying to imagine what it would be like to wake up with no concept of what money is..."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""If you encountered it in a novel,..."
links.text: "If you encountered it in a novel, you'd say it sounded like a plot contrivance, or like a fantasy."

links.title: You: ""Listen, I wouldn't believe it eith..."
links.text: "Listen, I wouldn't believe it either, but I swear it's the truth."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Either that, or an *extremely* con..."
links.text: "Either that, or an *extremely* convincing act..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""No, it's just like Mazov wrote: 'T..."
links.text: "No, it's just like Mazov wrote: 'The freeman of the future will be he who awakens in perfect ignorance of Capital'."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Wait, Steban, are you saying the g..."
links.text: "Wait, Steban, are you saying the gendarme is some kind of *future communist*?"

links.title: You: ""But isn't the point that money is..."
links.text: "But isn't the point that money is itself just a collective fantasy?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Perhaps, but it's a fantasy that *..."
links.text: "Perhaps, but it's a fantasy that *pays* for things, like your hostel bill..."

links.title: You: ""I'll tell you how I infiltrated th..."
links.text: "I'll tell you how I infiltrated the Wild Pines for my investigation..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Sounds like old-fashioned revoluti..."
links.text: "Sounds like old-fashioned revolutionary espionage. Let's see where this goes..."

links.title: You: ""Let me tell you about a little *in..."
links.text: "Let me tell you about a little *incident* I had with this woman at my hostel..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""A story with an erotico-political..."
links.text: "A story with an erotico-political angle. Let's see where this goes..."

links.title: You: ""You ever heard of a thing called '..."
links.text: "You ever heard of a thing called 'sudden onset acute amnesia'?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, we're getting into the psychia..."
links.text: "Oh, we're getting into the psychiatric pathologies of life under capital. Let's see where this goes..."

links.title: You: "(Crack your knuckles.) "Alright, le..."
links.text: (Crack your knuckles.) "Alright, let's do this interview."

links.title: Composure: "Nope, still no words. Your confiden..."
links.text: Nope, still no words. Your confidence account is overdrawn. What are you even doing here?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Now you're just psyching yourself o..."
links.text: Now you're just psyching yourself out. You've read plenty of books. Maybe try again once you've got your wits about you?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Maybe now's a good time to call it..."
links.text: Maybe now's a good time to call it an evening. Why don't you find a good book, clear your mind, and come back when you're refreshed?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Have you considered reading a *book..."
links.text: Have you considered reading a *book*? Those tend to have *lots* of words in them...

links.title: Composure: "Okay, you got this. You *got* this...."
links.text: Okay, you got this. You *got* this. Just... open your mouth, and say the words...

links.title: You: ""Ehhk...""
links.text: "Ehhk..."

links.title: Composure: "What are those sounds? They're like..."
links.text: What are those sounds? They're like the last mumblings of a mortally wounded badger.

links.title: Volition: "There's nothing you can do. It's li..."
links.text: There's nothing you can do. It's like your lips have been glued together.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything in order, detective?" T..."
links.text: "Everything in order, detective?" The lieutenant gives you a concerned look.

links.title: You: "Nod your head yes."
links.text: Nod your head yes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's a 'yes,' I take it? Can you..."
links.text: "That's a 'yes,' I take it? Can you give me an affirmative?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "What are you worried about? You've..."
links.text: What are you worried about? You've read plenty of books. Why don't you take a little pause, come back once your mind's clear?

links.title: Rhetoric: "You're intimidated by all the books..."
links.text: You're intimidated by all the books these kids have read, aren't you? Maybe a trip to the bookstore would do you some good.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What is it? Are you scared because..."
links.text: What is it? Are you scared because you can't remember a single book you've read?

links.title: You: "Nod again."
links.text: Nod again.

links.title: You: "Shake your head no."
links.text: Shake your head no.

links.title: You: "Shake your head no."
links.text: Shake your head no.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""As in, 'No, everything is *not* in..."
links.text: "As in, 'No, everything is *not* in order'? Can you give me a negative, detective?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "What are you worried about? You've..."
links.text: What are you worried about? You've read plenty of books. Why don't you take a little pause, come back once your mind's clear?

links.title: Rhetoric: "You're intimidated by all the books..."
links.text: You're intimidated by all the books these kids have read, aren't you? Maybe a trip to the bookstore would do you some good.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What is it? Are you scared because..."
links.text: What is it? Are you scared because you can't remember a single book you've read?

links.title: You: "Nod again."
links.text: Nod again.

links.title: You: "Shake your head no."
links.text: Shake your head no.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man gives you a concerned..."
links.text: The young man gives you a concerned look.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Is everything alright? Is there so..."
links.text: "Is everything alright? Is there something you're trying to say?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It seems he's lost his words. A ca..."
links.text: "It seems he's lost his words. A case of momentary aphasia, it looks like..." The lieutenant does not appear overly concerned.

links.title: Logic: "It wouldn't be the first neurologic..."
links.text: It wouldn't be the first neurological episode you've experienced on this case.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""These things happen with him somet..."
links.text: "These things happen with him sometimes. I recommend a change of subject."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In any case, a change of subject m..."
links.text: "In any case, a change of subject might help."

links.title: You: "Nod your head."
links.text: Nod your head.

links.title: Composure: "This isn't going to work. Maybe the..."
links.text: This isn't going to work. Maybe there's some other way you could prove yourself to them?

links.title: Logic: "Momentary aphasia, it seems. Just o..."
links.text: Momentary aphasia, it seems. Just one more neurological episode for the station lazareth to look into during your next check-up.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""He looks like he's about to puke.""
links.text: "He looks like he's about to puke."

links.title: Endurance: "There might be a little bile gather..."
links.text: There might be a little bile gathering at the back of your throat, but it's just a taste. The source of this issue is higher up the wire...

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Would it help if we changed the su..."
links.text: "Would it help if we changed the subject?"

links.title: You: ""Uhhm...""
links.text: "Uhhm..."

links.title: You: ""Hrrrgh...""
links.text: "Hrrrgh..."

links.title: Composure: "Is it getting warm in here? There s..."
links.text: Is it getting warm in here? There seems to be a little pool of sweat forming in the depression of your lower back.

links.title: You: "Why is this happening? I thought I..."
links.text: Why is this happening? I thought I had my shit together!

links.title: Composure: "You did. You must be extremely nerv..."
links.text: You did. You must be extremely nervous for some reason.

links.title: You: "I'm not nervous, I'm a superstar."
links.text: I'm not nervous, I'm a superstar.

links.title: Composure: "Oh, totally. A superstar breaking o..."
links.text: Oh, totally. A superstar breaking out in a cold sweat.

links.title: You: "Definitely not sweating, no sir. (W..."
links.text: Definitely not sweating, no sir. (Wipe the sweat away.)

links.title: Composure: "Excellent work, now there's a glist..."
links.text: Excellent work, now there's a glistening smear across your bare chest. Everyone will be able to see the evidence of your overactive sweat glands.

links.title: You: "It's because I don't do well in int..."
links.text: It's because I don't do well in interviews.

links.title: Composure: "No, you're terrible at them. The th..."
links.text: No, you're terrible at them. The thought of everyone looking at you, judging you, makes you want to heave, frankly...

links.title: You: "Why am I getting so worked up? They..."
links.text: Why am I getting so worked up? They're just a couple of kids!

links.title: Composure: "Let's be frank, they're probably wa..."
links.text: Let's be frank, they're probably way smarter than you. You bet they've read more books than you can even name...

links.title: Rhetoric: "Of course, it wouldn't kill you to..."
links.text: Of course, it wouldn't kill you to crack open a book every once in a while.

links.title: Composure: "The hardest part will just be worki..."
links.text: The hardest part will just be working up the nerve to ask without soiling yourself.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Everything alright, gendarme? You..."
links.text: "Everything alright, gendarme? You look a little green about the gills..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "You've been quite studious these pa..."
links.text: You've been quite studious these past few days. You should be able to handle whatever they want to throw your way.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Of course, if you're nervous it wou..."
links.text: Of course, if you're nervous it wouldn't hurt to read another book or two.

links.title: You: ""Listen, there's got to be some oth..."
links.text: "Listen, there's got to be some other way I could prove myself to the group."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""'Some other way'?" He squints at y..."
links.text: "'Some other way'?" He squints at you. "If you're not much of a reader, why are you so dead-set on joining this reading group?"

links.title: You: ""It's important that I further my c..."
links.text: "It's important that I further my critical studies."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I suppose we are all here to advan..."
links.text: "I suppose we are all here to advance our studies in some form or another..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But to be perfectly frank, I just..."
links.text: "But to be perfectly frank, I just don't see it happening."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Steban, a moment..." The young man..."
links.text: "Steban, a moment..." The young man's companion beckons him into a private conference.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""What... really? You're saying... b..."
links.text: "What... really? You're saying... but there's no way... uh huh... yes, okay, I'm listening..."

links.title: Empathy: "A note of real uncertainty in his v..."
links.text: A note of real uncertainty in his voice.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Alright, gendarme." He turns back..."
links.text: "Alright, gendarme." He turns back to you. "Comrade Ulixes and I have conferred about it, and we've come up with an alternative way for you to convince us of your commitment to the group."

links.title: You: ""What's that?""
links.text: "What's that?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man gives his companion a..."
links.text: The young man gives his companion an uncertain glance. The companion nods his head vigorously.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I want you... to hit me.""
links.text: "I want you... to hit me."

links.title: You: ""*Hit* you?""
links.text: "*Hit* you?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It doesn't have to be a *hard* hit..."
links.text: "It doesn't have to be a *hard* hit." He indicates his cheek. "Just enough to leave a mark."

links.title: You: ""Why would I do that?""
links.text: "Why would I do that?"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""The idea," his companion jumps in,..."
links.text: "The idea," his companion jumps in, "is to show Maurice and those other traitors that we're the only reading group *hard core* enough to tangle with the RCM..."

links.title: Half Light: "Now's your chance to redeem yoursel..."
links.text: Now's your chance to redeem yourself for that dive you took before the gremlin child.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, we're replaying *this* little..."
links.text: "Ah, we're replaying *this* little episode. Please, do try to stay on your feet this time."

links.title: Volition: "Of course, this isn't some punch-ou..."
links.text: Of course, this isn't some punch-out competition. You just want to leave a harmless bruise.

links.title: Logic: "Just theorising here, but if you do..."
links.text: Just theorising here, but if you don't have as much control over your muscle groups as you'd like, perhaps you could try something you *know* is bound to fail...

links.title: You: "Wait, you're saying I could try to..."
links.text: Wait, you're saying I could try to really lay this kid out, knowing I'll probably screw it up?

links.title: Logic: "Precisely! It's brilliant."
links.text: Precisely! It's brilliant.

links.title: Logic: "Assuming you don't accidentally suc..."
links.text: Assuming you don't accidentally succeed...

links.title: You: "That sounds really stupid."
links.text: That sounds really stupid.

links.title: Logic: "Yes, stupidly *brilliant*."
links.text: Yes, stupidly *brilliant*.

links.title: You: ""Kim, how bad an idea is this?""
links.text: "Kim, how bad an idea is this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you, then a..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks at you, then at the young man. He seems to be giving your question serious consideration.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Speaking as an officer of the RCM,..."
links.text: "Speaking as an officer of the RCM, it is an *extremely* bad idea to strike a civilian without cause..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""However, if one were to strike a c..."
links.text: "However, if one were to strike a civilian, which again I would never recommend, one should at least follow the RCM manual's guidance on non-lethal strikes."

links.title: You: ""What does the manual say?""
links.text: "What does the manual say?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It advises officers in physical al..."
links.text: "It advises officers in physical altercations to rely on the open-palm strike, as opposed to the backhand, in non-lethal situations."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can't recall the exact explanati..."
links.text: "I can't recall the exact explanation, but it has something to do with the kinetic energy stored in the elbow. Basically, you're less able to control a *backhanded* slap, and therefore more likely to cause serious injury."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Or even death, if, say, you happen..."
links.text: "Or even death, if, say, you happen to be wearing a set of armoured ceramic gauntlets."

links.title: You: ""I don't need a book to tell me how..."
links.text: "I don't need a book to tell me how to deck a guy."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You see, that attitude is precisel..."
links.text: "You see, that attitude is precisely why the field manual's guidance is so valuable..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Speaking frankly, it's a terrible..."
links.text: "Speaking frankly, it's a terrible idea. The RCM already has issues with *wanton brutality* and this is unlikely to ameliorate those concerns..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""At the same time, this is emphatic..."
links.text: "At the same time, this is emphatically *your thing*, so do as you will."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, gendarme? What are we waitin..."
links.text: "Well, gendarme? What are we waiting for?"

links.title: You: ""Hey, Kim. what if *you* hit him?""
links.text: "Hey, Kim. what if *you* hit him?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's no *what if*, because I wo..."
links.text: "There's no *what if*, because I won't. This is your thing, remember?"

links.title: You: "Hit him, but not too hard."
links.text: Hit him, but not too hard.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "As with all applications of violenc..."
links.text: As with all applications of violence, the key is the appropriate amount of force exercised with absolute control on the part of the wielder.

links.title: Interfacing: "At the moment of contact the high-p..."
links.text: At the moment of contact the high-performance gripping that covers the palm of your glove causes your hand to *stick* for an instant against the young man's cheek. As your hand pulls away, his pale skin appears momentarily to follow with it.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man staggers back into th..."
links.text: The young man staggers back into the couch, eyes agog and momentarily dazed, but not seriously hurt.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not the best look for the RCM, but..."
links.text: "Not the best look for the RCM, but I suppose it could've gone worse."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Steban? Are you alright?""
links.text: "Steban? Are you alright?"

links.title: You: ""Who's the baddest communist now?""
links.text: "Who's the baddest communist now?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""That... was *amazing*. Uli, perhap..."
links.text: "That... was *amazing*. Uli, perhaps we should tangle with the gendarmerie more often." The young man rubs his cheek.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "It doesn't hurt, yet. The rush of e..."
links.text: It doesn't hurt, yet. The rush of endorphins will keep the pain at bay for a while yet.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "In the meantime, a small indigo flo..."
links.text: In the meantime, a small indigo flower begins to bloom just below his cheekbone.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Yes, this worked out quite nicely...."
links.text: "Yes, this worked out quite nicely." He seems immensely pleased with himself.

links.title: You: ""You need this?" (Offer him Kim's h..."
links.text: "You need this?" (Offer him Kim's handkerchief.)

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""No, keep it. I feel... *great*, ac..."
links.text: "No, keep it. I feel... *great*, actually..." He turns to his companion. "Perhaps we should tangle with the gendarmerie more often."

links.title: Composure: "He isn't bluffing. He appears invig..."
links.text: He isn't bluffing. He appears invigorated, as though he's truly experiencing life for the first time.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "That would be the sweet endorphin r..."
links.text: That would be the sweet endorphin rush. You've granted him a natural high, at least until the hurt sets in.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I'm fine. Better than fine, actual..."
links.text: "I'm fine. Better than fine, actually." The young man rubs his cheek. "Perhaps we should tangle with the gendarmerie more often."

links.title: Authority: "You've earned his respect. See how..."
links.text: You've earned his respect. See how you've *marked* him?

links.title: Physical Instrument: "A little ice on it will keep the sw..."
links.text: A little ice on it will keep the swelling down. He'll be fine in a day or two.

links.title: Interfacing: "At the moment of contact you feel t..."
links.text: At the moment of contact you feel the wool of your fingerless gloves entangling with the wiry hairs of the young man's beard. His eyes are wide as a pair of old silver coins.

links.title: Interfacing: "The actual moment of contact is eve..."
links.text: The actual moment of contact is ever-so-slightly disappointing, as the feeling is dulled by the yellow latex shell that contains your hand.

links.title: Interfacing: "Ensconced in your ceramic armour, y..."
links.text: Ensconced in your ceramic armour, you barely notice the moment of contact. Striking the young man's face is almost indistinguishable from swatting away a fly.

links.title: Interfacing: "At the moment of contact you feel t..."
links.text: At the moment of contact you feel the pads of your bare fingers brush the wiry hairs of the young man's beard, as though caressing a wad of kitchen wool.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "TOO STRONG, KILLER."
links.text: TOO STRONG, KILLER.

links.title: Interfacing: "En route to its target your FALN gl..."
links.text: En route to its target your FALN glove traces a strangely pleasing black-and-white blur through the air, like some kind of ultra-sonic weasel.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Of course, it's not *actually* ultr..."
links.text: Of course, it's not *actually* ultra-sonic, that's just an illusion produced by good branding. Still, the force you've unleashed really is tremendous.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Steban, can you hear me?""
links.text: "Steban, can you hear me?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good god, detective! What's wrong..."
links.text: "Good god, detective! What's wrong with you?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Errrrck." The young man cradles hi..."
links.text: "Errrrck." The young man cradles his jaw and looks up, his expression blank.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You're both lucky you didn't shatte..."
links.text: You're both lucky you didn't shatter his cheekbone. He may want to count his teeth before he goes to bed tonight.

links.title: You: ""Oh, god. I'm sorry about that.""
links.text: "Oh, god. I'm sorry about that."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""*Sorry*? You nearly took my fuckin..."
links.text: "*Sorry*? You nearly took my fucking jaw off!"

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You think you can hear a slight pop..."
links.text: You think you can hear a slight popping sound as he moves his mouth.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It seems the face of violent react..."
links.text: "It seems the face of violent reaction has revealed itself..."

links.title: You: ""Let that be a lesson to you.""
links.text: "Let that be a lesson to you."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""What lesson is that, huh? That the..."
links.text: "What lesson is that, huh? That the RCM are assholes? That they'll take your fucking jaw off?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It certainly won't improve your pre..."
links.text: It certainly won't improve your precinct's image within the community.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""What? You're just gonna stand ther..."
links.text: "What? You're just gonna stand there after you nearly broke my fucking jaw?"

links.title: Authority: "That's right. You don't *owe* him a..."
links.text: That's right. You don't *owe* him any explanation.

links.title: Interfacing: "At the moment of contact you're rem..."
links.text: At the moment of contact you're reminded of a fight you once witnessed between two homeless men in an alleyway. Could it be that you've set out to recreate that moment now, right down to the smelly fingerless gloves?

links.title: Interfacing: "Even through the yellow latex shell..."
links.text: Even through the yellow latex shell containing your hand you can feel the force of the impact against the young man's cheekbone.

links.title: Interfacing: "Ensconced in your ceramic armour, y..."
links.text: Ensconced in your ceramic armour, you barely notice the moment of contact. But you do hear the distinct *ting* of your knuckles catching the young man's cheekbone.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Oh god, tell us you haven't done it..."
links.text: Oh god, tell us you haven't done it *again*. Are you twice the killer now?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Oh, no. Tell us you didn't *really*..."
links.text: Oh, no. Tell us you didn't *really* kill him.

links.title: Interfacing: "You feel a bright pain as your bare..."
links.text: You feel a bright pain as your bare knuckle collides with the young man's oddly prominent cheekbone. At the moment of contact his eyes are wide as old silver coins.

links.title: You: "Hit him as hard as you can."
links.text: Hit him as hard as you can.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "OH YEAH, we're gonna spin this kid..."
links.text: OH YEAH, we're gonna spin this kid like a top!

links.title: Logic: "Wait-wait-wait, you were trying *no..."
links.text: Wait-wait-wait, you were trying *not* to do that!

links.title: Physical Instrument: "If you were trying this against an..."
links.text: If you were trying this against an actual opponent, it would be a meagre, embarrassing effort.

links.title: Logic: "Fortunately, you're trying *not* to..."
links.text: Fortunately, you're trying *not* to cause any real damage.

links.title: You: ""This is absurd. I don't want to hi..."
links.text: "This is absurd. I don't want to hit you." (Cancel task.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods."
links.text: The lieutenant nods.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "And yet you can't help but sense a..."
links.text: And yet you can't help but sense a slight disappointment on his part. It seems a part of him hoped you would hit the pretentious young communist...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank god we avoided *that* fiasco..."
links.text: "Thank god we avoided *that* fiasco, at least..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man can hardly conceal hi..."
links.text: The young man can hardly conceal his disappointment. He was apparently looking forward to being punched by you.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, if you're not going to play..."
links.text: "Well, if you're not going to play along, I don't think we have anything further to discuss. Good evening to you, gendarme."

links.title: Half Light: "Now's your chance to avenge yoursel..."
links.text: Now's your chance to avenge yourself for your embarrassment by the harbour gates.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This has certainly turned out to b..."
links.text: "This has certainly turned out to be a punchier case than I had anticipated."

links.title: Half Light: "He won't be the first unweaned punk..."
links.text: He won't be the first unweaned punk you've shut down. You'll make mincemeat of this fool's jaw.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, so we're beating *another* you..."
links.text: "Ah, so we're beating *another* youth only tangentially connected to the case. Spectacular."

links.title: Half Light: "You've done it before, and against..."
links.text: You've done it before, and against a *much* tougher opponent. You'll make mincemeat of this fool's jaw.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Easy, detective. No need to treat..."
links.text: "Easy, detective. No need to treat this kid like he's some Son of Measurehead."

links.title: Half Light: "This is what you've been waiting fo..."
links.text: This is what you've been waiting for! Time to lay his little punk-ass out.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, so we're beating the youth now..."
links.text: "Ah, so we're beating the youth now? That's an unexpected development."

links.title: You: ""I'm a completionist. I've got to f..."
links.text: "I'm a completionist. I've got to finish what I start."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I do have to admire a certain tena..."
links.text: "I do have to admire a certain tenacity, even when it seems to make no sense."

links.title: You: ""Because this plasm stuff sounds to..."
links.text: "Because this plasm stuff sounds totally disco. I have to get to the bottom of it."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Oh, it *is*, and it only gets *mor..."
links.text: "Oh, it *is*, and it only gets *more disco* from here..."

links.title: You: ""Like Ignus Nilsen himself, I've co..."
links.text: "Like Ignus Nilsen himself, I've come to foretell a Great Reckoning."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Hmmm. I thought I perceived some *..."
links.text: "Hmmm. I thought I perceived some *eschatological* air about you..."

links.title: You: ""I've come so far, please don't tur..."
links.text: "I've come so far, please don't turn me back now."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man sighs. "God, it's so..."
links.text: The young man sighs. "God, it's so pitiful watching a grown man beg. I can hardly stand it."

links.title: You: ""I'm ready... let's talk about infr..."
links.text: "I'm ready... let's talk about infra-materialism."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Yes, let's get right to it.""
links.text: "Yes, let's get right to it."

links.title: Echo Maker: "His companion leans forward, ready..."
links.text: His companion leans forward, ready to jump in...

links.title: Rhetoric: "They're impressed that you dove rig..."
links.text: They're impressed that you dove right in to the most advanced parts of the theory. Half an hour evaporates and the conversation is still wending its way toward new and unexpected places...

links.title: Shivers: "A cool breeze coming off the bay wr..."
links.text: A cool breeze coming off the bay wraps itself around the Capeside Apartments. In a nearly forgotten part of that glorified construction site, surrounded by rusted pieces of scaffolding and walls of faded tarpaulin, a detective of the RCM debates the intricacies of an abstruse theory with a pair of university students...

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... but if it's true that this ind..."
links.text: "... but if it's true that this individual possesses *so much capital* that light literally *bends* around him, then that must mean..."

links.title: You: ""That *capital* produces its *own*..."
links.text: "That *capital* produces its *own* form of plasm!"

links.title: Echo Maker: ""In 'Innocence of Capital', Puncher..."
links.text: "In 'Innocence of Capital', Puncher and Wattmann argue that communists must possess as little capital as possible, in order to keep their thinking *undiluted* by its influence..."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Watch out. You call yourself a comm..."
links.text: Watch out. You call yourself a communist and yet you've been accumulating a *suspiciously* large share of capital in just the last few days. It's almost certainly distorting your thinking.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You've accrued a modest account bal..."
links.text: You've accrued a modest account balance over the last few days, but probably not enough to warp your thinking *too* much.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Nothing to fear. Judging from your..."
links.text: Nothing to fear. Judging from your account balance, you should be thinking *extremely* clearly.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Again, he was just a regular high-..."
links.text: "Again, he was just a regular high-net-worth individual. There was nothing *extra-physical* about him..."

links.title: You: ""That *light itself* is a bourgeois..."
links.text: "That *light itself* is a bourgeois illusion!"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""*Or* it suggests that capital, in..."
links.text: "*Or* it suggests that capital, in sufficient quantities, must exhibit its own plasm-like qualities..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""... but my question is where does..."
links.text: "... but my question is where does the RCM *recruit* all these hyper-revolutionaries to join this 'Remote Viewers Division'?"

links.title: You: ""It's less that you're 'recruited'..."
links.text: "It's less that you're 'recruited' into the RVD and more like you're *called*."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Fascinating...""
links.text: "Fascinating..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, only the detective here would..."
links.text: "Yes, only the detective here would draw a connection between a made-up division of para-psychics and the addled ramblings of a defunct communist mage..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man ignores the lieutenan..."
links.text: The young man ignores the lieutenant. "But I suppose it makes sense that some common strain of infra-materialist thought would persist in the RCM, even to this day, given its origins."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "A fortunate turn that the lieutenan..."
links.text: A fortunate turn that the lieutenant isn't here. Imagine what he would have to say about this.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man nods thoughtfully. "B..."
links.text: The young man nods thoughtfully. "But I suppose it makes sense that some common strain of infra-materialist thought would persist in the RCM, even to this day, given its origins."

links.title: You: ""And my *point* is that maybe these..."
links.text: "And my *point* is that maybe these *hyper-revolutionary* individuals are more common than infra-materialism generally assumes..."

links.title: You: ""... all I'm saying is if you want..."
links.text: "... all I'm saying is if you want to get *really extra-physical*, pyrholidon is the way to go..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""...""
Kim Kitsuragi: ""...""
Echo Maker: ""...""
You: ""... anyway, I think I've made my p..."
links.text: "... anyway, I think I've made my point."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Undoubtedly.""
links.text: "Undoubtedly."

links.title: You: ""... or maybe I'm wrong. It could r..."
links.text: "... or maybe I'm wrong. It could really go either way."

links.title: You: ""... but I'm still trying to figure..."
links.text: "... but I'm still trying to figure out how the *pale* fits into all this..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""The two phenomena are actually dee..."
links.text: "The two phenomena are actually deeply intertwined." He nods. "Many infra-materialists believe that pale is actually a manifestation of nostalgia and historical inertia..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Those same theorists have hypothes..."
links.text: "Those same theorists have hypothesised that revolution may in fact create a *counter-force* that prevents the pale from expanding."

links.title: Shivers: "Now the breeze has subsided. All is..."
links.text: Now the breeze has subsided. All is still except for the last bits of steam rising from the coffee pot.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, on that note, I think we can..."
links.text: "Well, on that note, I think we can call it an evening."

links.title: Conceptualization: "No, wait! Can this really be the en..."
links.text: No, wait! Can this really be the end? You feel like you've just gotten to the real stuff.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Yes. One of our better discussions..."
links.text: "Yes. One of our better discussions lately, on the whole."

links.title: You: ""Hang on, is that *it*?""
links.text: "Hang on, is that *it*?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""What do you mean, 'is that it'? Yo..."
links.text: "What do you mean, 'is that it'? You've done the reading, we talked about it, what more do you expect from a reading group?"

links.title: You: ""What if I have more questions, you..."
links.text: "What if I have more questions, you know, about communism?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Well, you could always *ask*, I gu..."
links.text: "Well, you could always *ask*, I guess." The two young men look at each other a moment.

links.title: Echo Maker: ""He probably won't get a better cha..."
links.text: "He probably won't get a better chance, honestly."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But it's getting late, so maybe pi..."
links.text: "But it's getting late, so maybe pick the *most important* question?"

links.title: You: ""Kim, what should I ask?""
links.text: "Kim, what should I ask?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, how should *I* know wha..."
links.text: "Detective, how should *I* know what questions *you* have about communism?"

links.title: You: ""I need a minute to think about it.""
links.text: "I need a minute to think about it."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Come on. We have things to do in t..."
links.text: "Come on. We have things to do in the morning."

links.title: You: "Ask the most important question abo..."
links.text: Ask the most important question about communism.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The question you mean to ask is bot..."
links.text: The question you mean to ask is both very complicated and incredibly simple...

links.title: Endurance: "Take a deep breath. Best to go one..."
links.text: Take a deep breath. Best to go one piece at a time.

links.title: You: ""If communism is all based on *theo..."
links.text: "If communism is all based on *theories* that are impossible to prove..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man waits patiently for y..."
links.text: The young man waits patiently for you to finish.

links.title: You: ""... and the rest of the world keep..."
links.text: "... and the rest of the world keeps killing us for our beliefs..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Yes?""
links.text: "Yes?"

links.title: Volition: "Say it."
links.text: Say it.

links.title: You: ""... what's the point?""
links.text: "... what's the point?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man considers your words..."
links.text: The young man considers your words for a minute.

links.title: Composure: "You're witnessing his ironic armour..."
links.text: You're witnessing his ironic armour melt before you. This is his *true self* you're seeing now.

links.title: Empathy: "He's thinking about someone..."
links.text: He's thinking about someone...

links.title: You: "Wait, who is he thinking about?"
links.text: Wait, who is he thinking about?

links.title: Empathy: "Hard to say. Someone dear to him."
links.text: Hard to say. Someone dear to him.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Track his gaze. He's looking out pa..."
links.text: Track his gaze. He's looking out past the broken wall, toward the opposite side of the Bay...

links.title: You: "Toward the skyscrapers of La Delta."
links.text: Toward the skyscrapers of La Delta.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "They rise like electric obelisks in..."
links.text: They rise like electric obelisks in the night.

links.title: You: "What's there?"
links.text: What's there?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Many tall buildings, belonging to a..."
links.text: Many tall buildings, belonging to a district whose name escapes you.

links.title: You: "Let the thought go."
links.text: Let the thought go.

links.title: You: "Forget it."
links.text: Forget it.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""The theorists Puncher and Wattmann..."
links.text: "The theorists Puncher and Wattmann -- not infra-materialists, but theorists nonetheless -- say that communism is a secular version of Perikarnassian theology, that it replaces faith in the divine with faith in humanity's future..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I have to say, I've never *entirel..."
links.text: "I have to say, I've never *entirely* understood what they mean, but I think maybe the answer is in there, somewhere."

links.title: You: ""Wait, you're saying communism is s..."
links.text: "Wait, you're saying communism is some kind of religion?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Only in this very specific sense...."
links.text: "Only in this very specific sense. Communism doesn't dangle any promises of eternal bliss or reward. The only promise it offers is that the future can be better than the past, if we're willing to work and fight and die for it."

links.title: You: ""But what if you don't believe ther..."
links.text: "But what if you don't believe there *is* a future?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Then you don't believe in the hist..."
links.text: "Then you don't believe in the historic role of the proletariat, which also means you reject the basis of historical materialism."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""It means you're not a communist, i..."
links.text: "It means you're not a communist, in other words."

links.title: You: ""What are you then?""
links.text: "What are you then?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Something else..." The young man s..."
links.text: "Something else..." The young man shakes his head.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I guess you could say we believe i..."
links.text: "I guess you could say we believe it *because it's impossible*." He looks at the scattered matchboxes on the ground. "It's our way of saying we refuse to accept that the world has to remain... like this..."

links.title: You: ""Broken.""
links.text: "Broken."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Yes, that's a good way to think of..."
links.text: "Yes, that's a good way to think of it, broken, but not irreparable."

links.title: You: ""It's a nice thought.""
links.text: "It's a nice thought."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""A thought can be a very powerful t..."
links.text: "A thought can be a very powerful thing. That's the whole idea of infra-materialism..."

links.title: Empathy: "His words aren't really directed at..."
links.text: His words aren't really directed at you. He's wrestling with himself now...

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Steban, it's getting pretty late.""
links.text: "Steban, it's getting pretty late."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You're right... We should clean th..."
links.text: "You're right... We should clean this up and get going." He gestures to the matchboxes.

links.title: Interfacing: "Of course, the matchboxes! You'd ve..."
links.text: Of course, the matchboxes! You'd very nearly forgotten to ask about them. Now may be your last chance...

links.title: You: ""I don't know if I believe it, thou..."
links.text: "I don't know if I believe it, though."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""You've got to believe in *somethin..."
links.text: "You've got to believe in *something*. Otherwise, what are you doing?"

links.title: You: ""Unfinished.""
links.text: "Unfinished."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Yes, that's a good way to think of..."
links.text: "Yes, that's a good way to think of it... a work-in-progress."

links.title: You: ""Who's in those skyscrapers over th..."
links.text: "Who's in those skyscrapers over there?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""My mums." The young man looks surp..."
links.text: "My mums." The young man looks surprised. "She works in one of those skyscrapers, but it's not like you think... she's a cleaning lady..."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""But how did you... oh, never mind...."
links.text: "But how did you... oh, never mind. I guess I'm easier to read than I thought..."

links.title: You: ""Why do you call her 'mums'"?"
links.text: "Why do you call her 'mums'"?

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Because I always have. Though I tr..."
links.text: "Because I always have. Though I try not to do it too often now... it's kind of embarrassing, isn't it?"

links.title: Empathy: "You made him self-conscious now. He..."
links.text: You made him self-conscious now. He's practically paralysed.

links.title: You: ""She's given up a lot for you.""
links.text: "She's given up a lot for you."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""We all have to make sacrifices for..."
links.text: "We all have to make sacrifices for the future. Maybe that's what I was trying to get at earlier..."

links.title: You: ""You want her to live in a better w..."
links.text: "You want her to live in a better world."

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I want us *all* to live in a bette..."
links.text: "I want us *all* to live in a better world. But yes... she's a part of it... I guess we're all a part of it..."

links.title: You: ""You're thinking about someone, are..."
links.text: "You're thinking about someone, aren't you?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Yes, in fact... my mums." The youn..."
links.text: "Yes, in fact... my mums." The young man smiles sheepishly. "She works in La Delta... in one of those skyscrapers, but it's not like you think... she's a cleaning lady."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: "The young man appears lost inside h..."
links.text: The young man appears lost inside his own thoughts...

links.title: Shivers: "A cold wind whips at the canvas. Fr..."
links.text: A cold wind whips at the canvas. From far below, the sounds of waves smashing themselves against the rocks. You are exposed.

links.title: You: "Pull your jacket tighter."
links.text: Pull your jacket tighter.

links.title: You: "Rub your arms with your hands."
links.text: Rub your arms with your hands.

links.title: Shivers: "Somehow you only now realise that t..."
links.text: Somehow you only now realise that the temperature has been dropping steadily for the last half hour.

links.title: You: ""Okay, but what if you *know* there..."
links.text: "Okay, but what if you *know* there isn't going to be a future?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""I'm not sure I get what you're dri..."
links.text: "I'm not sure I get what you're driving at. Of course there will be a future, even if the form it takes might appear unrecognisable. That's the spiral of progress."

links.title: You: ""But what if humanity keeps letting..."
links.text: "But what if humanity keeps letting us down?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Nobody said fulfilling the proleta..."
links.text: "Nobody said fulfilling the proletariat's historic role would be easy." A tight smile. "It demands great faith with no promise of tangible reward. But that doesn't mean we can simply give up."

links.title: You: ""Even when they ignore us?""
links.text: "Even when they ignore us?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Even then.""
links.text: "Even then."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Mazov says it's the arrogance of c..."
links.text: "Mazov says it's the arrogance of capital that will be its ultimate undoing. It does not believe it can fail, which is why it must fail."

links.title: Volition: "So young. So *unbearably* young..."
links.text: So young. So *unbearably* young...

links.title: Half Light: "Why do you see the two of them with..."
links.text: Why do you see the two of them with their backs against a bullet-pocked wall, all of a sudden?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Their faces, blurred yet frozen as..."
links.text: Their faces, blurred yet frozen as though in ambrotype. You were never *that young*, were you?

links.title: You: ""Even when they laugh at us?""
links.text: "Even when they laugh at us?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Even then.""
links.text: "Even then."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""Mazov tells us to laugh at the mon..."
links.text: "Mazov tells us to laugh at the monster that hides behind false hopes and pieties."

links.title: You: ""Even when they shoot at us?""
links.text: "Even when they shoot at us?"

links.title: Steban, the Student Communist: ""Especially then.""
links.text: "Especially then."

links.title: Echo Maker: ""And of course, we'll be shooting r..."
links.text: "And of course, we'll be shooting right back."

links.title: Empathy: "There's something going on in there..."
